section.name: CubeScript
section.description: This section describes identifiers that are closely related to the CubeScript language.

command.name: <f
command.description: Compares if a particular floating-point value is smaller than another floating-point value.

command.name: <=f
command.description: Compares if a particular floating-point value is less than or equal to another floating-point value.

command.name: =f
command.description: Compares if a particular floating-point value is equal to another floating-point value.

command.name: >f
command.description: Determines if the first floating-point value is greater than the second floating-point value.

command.name: >=f
command.description: Determines if the first floating-point value is greater than or equal to the second floating-point value.

command.name: !=f
command.description: Determines if the first floating-point value is not equal to the second floating-point value.

command.name: result
command.description: Sets the result value of a cubescript block.

command.name: execute
command.description: Executes the specified string as cubescript.

command.name: push
command.description: Temporarily redefines the value of an alias.

command.name: getalias
command.description: Returns the value of the alias.

command.name: getvarrange
command.description: Gets range attribute for builtin variable.

argument.description: the name of any builtin variable (integer or float)

command.name: isIdent
command.description: Returns whether or not there is an identifier by that name.

command.name: modf
command.description: Performs a floating-point modulo operation.

command.name: powf
command.description: Returns A raised to the power of B (floating-point).

return.description: A raised to the power of B

command.name: pop
command.description: Resets a previously pushed alias to it's original value.

remarks.remark: It is allowed to use multiple arguments for "pop". So instead of "pop var_a ; pop var_b" you can write "pop var_a var_b". Also, "pop" will now give back the removed value of the first alias from the argument list. This allows using the pop'd value one last time.

example.code: p = 1; push p 2; pop p; echo $p

command.description: Performs an addition 2 or more numbers.

remarks.remark: Example: echo the sum of x and y is (+ $x $y)

command.description: Performs a subtraction.
Performs a multiplication 2 or more numbers.

command.name: div
command.description: Performs an integer division.

command.name: -f
command.description: Subtracts two floating-point numbers.

command.name: +f
command.description: Adds up two or more floating-point numbers.

command.name: *f
command.description: Performs a floating point multiplication 2 or more numbers.

command.name: divf
command.description: Performs a division with floating-point precision.
Adds a value to an alias.

remarks.remark: Example: += foo 1337

command.description: Subtracts a value from an alias.

remarks.remark: Example: -= foo 1337

command.description: Multiplies an alias by a value.

remarks.remark: Example: *= foo 1337

command.name: div=
command.description: Divides an alias by a value.

remarks.remark: Example: div= foo 1337

command.name: +=f
command.description: Adds a floating-point value to an alias.

remarks.remark: Example: +=f foo 13.37

command.name: -=f
command.description: Subtracts a floating-point value from an alias.

remarks.remark: Example: -=f foo 13.37

command.name: *=f
command.description: Multiplies an alias by a floating-point value.

remarks.remark: Example: *=f foo 13.37

command.name: div=f
command.description: Divides an alias by a floating-point value.

remarks.remark: Example: div=f foo 13.37

command.name: mod
command.description: Performs a modulo operation.
Determines if two values are equal.

example.code: echo there are only (concatword (= 1 1) (= 1 0)) types of people in the world
example.explanation: Output: there are only 10 types of people in the world

command.description: Determines if two values are not equal.
Determines if a value is smaller than a second value.
Determines if a value is bigger than a second value.
Determines if a values is less than or equal to a second value.
Determines if a values is greater than or equal to a second value.
Logical AND.
Logical OR.
Performs a negation.

command.name: &b
command.description: Performs the operation AND using binary arithmetic on integer values (32-bit signed).

command.name: |b
command.description: Performs the operation OR using binary arithmetic on integer values (32-bit signed).

command.name: ^b
command.description: Performs the operation XOR using binary arithmetic on integer values (32-bit signed).

command.name: !b
command.description: Performs the operation NOT using binary arithmetic on integer values (32-bit signed).

remarks.remark: Integer values are 32-bit signed values, so for example "echo (!b 1)" returns "-2".

command.name: h0
command.description: Returns value as string of hexadecimal digits, padded with leading zeros to a given minimum length (precision).

command.name: rnd
command.description: Random value.

argument.description: the upper limit of the random value

return.valueNotes: larger or equal 0 and smaller than A

command.name: round
command.description: Rounds the given float.

command.name: ceil
command.description: Upper value of a float number.

argument.description: the float number to get the ceil from

command.name: floor
command.description: Floor value of a float number.

argument.description: the float number to get the floor from

command.name: strcmp
command.description: Determines if two strings are equal.

example.code: if (strcmp yes yes) [echo the two strings are equal] [echo the two strings are not equal]
example.explanation: Output: the two strings are equal

command.name: strstr
command.description: Determines if string B was found in string A.

remarks.remark: It returns position of string B in string A (counting from 1) or zero, if not found.

example.code: if (strstr "Hello world!" Hello) [echo found Hello in Hello world!] [echo did not find Hello in Hello world!]
example.explanation: Output: found Hello in Hello world!

command.name: strlen
command.description: Returns the length (in characters, including whitespace) of string S.

command.name: substr
command.description: Copies a substring out of the original.

remarks.remark: Character indexes begins at 0. If "start position" is negative, the reference is the end of the string. It also counts negative length from total length, if "substring length" parameter is negative.

command.name: if
command.description: Controls the script flow based on a boolean expression.

example.code: if (> $x 10) [ echo x is bigger than 10 ] [ echo x too small ]

argument.description: the body to execute if the condition is true
the body to execute if the condition is false

command.name: switch
command.description: Takes an integer argument to determine what block of code to execute.

remarks.remark: This command can only handle up to 23 'cases' (because of cubescript's 24 argument limit).

example.code: switch 2 [echo case 0] [echo case 1] [echo case 2] [echo case 3] [echo case 4]

command.name: loop
command.description: Loops the specified body.

remarks.remark: This command sets the alias you choose, as first argument, from 0 to N-1 for every iteration.

argument.description: the body to execute on each iteration

command.name: while
command.description: Loops the specified body while the condition evaluates to true.

remarks.remark: This command sets the alias "i" from 0 to N-1 for every iteration. Note that the condition here has to have [], otherwise it would only be evaluated once.

example.code: alias i 0; while [ (< $i 10) ] [ echo $i; alias i (+ $i 1) ]

argument.valueNotes: the code evaluated before each iteration

argument.description: the body to execute on each iteration

command.name: looplist
command.description: Browses a list and executes a body for each element.

remarks.remark: It works optionally with several variables.

argument.description: the alias(es) containing the current element value
the body to execute on each iteration

command.name: looplisti
command.description: Browses a list and executes a body for each element.

remarks.remark: The same as looplist, but it automatically counts the loops in "i", starting with 0. It works optionally with several variables.

example.code: a = [u v w]; b = [x y z]; looplisti $a m [echo $m (at $b $i) $i]
example.explanation: Output: u x 0 , v y 1 , w z 2

argument.description: the alias(es) containing the current element value
the body to execute on each iteration

command.name: break
command.description: Aborts a loop created with a 'loop', 'looplist' or 'while' command.

command.name: continue
command.description: Skip current loop iteration.

command.name: concat
command.description: Concatenates multiple strings with spaces inbetween.

command.name: concatword
command.description: Concatenates multiple strings.

remarks.remark: The newly created string is saved to the alias 's'.

command.name: at
command.description: Grabs a word out of a string.

remarks.remark: Negative index number returns "".

return.description: the word from the specified idex

command.name: listlen
command.description: returns the element count of the given list.

command.name: findlist
command.description: Searches a list for a specified value.

return.description: the index of the item in the list

command.name: sleep
command.description: Executes a command after specified time period.

example.explanation: Prints 'foo' to the screen after 1 second.

command.name: resetsleeps
command.description: Resets all current "sleep".

variable.name: numargs
variable.description: The number of arguments passed to the current alias.

command.name: format
command.description: Replaces "%" format specifiers in the string by the values specified in subsequent arguments.

remarks.remark: In addition, it allows access to more than nine parameters. Parameter numbers of 10 and higher have to be prefixed with an additional zero. For example "%010" accesses parameter number ten.

example.code: echo (format "%1 bottles of %2 on the %3, %1 bottles of %2!" 99 beer wall)
example.explanation: output: 99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer!

command.name: format2
command.description: Replaces "%" format specifiers in the string by the values specified in subsequent arguments.

remarks.remark: Like "format" command, but all parameters are treated as lists and are exploded first.
In addition, it allows access to more than nine parameters. Parameter numbers of 10 and higher have to be prefixed with an additional zero. For example "%010" accesses parameter number ten.

example.code: echo (format "_%1_%2_%3_%4_%5_" "A B C" D E F)
echo (format2 "_%1_%2_%3_%4_%5_" "A B C" D E F)

command.name: \f
command.description: Adds color to a string.

remarks.remark: The whole string has to be included in quotes.

example.explanation: Output: a red "Hello" and a green "world!"

command.name: l0
command.description: Leading zeros for the number V to make it W chars wide.

remarks.remark: It may look like 10 - which might be considered a mnemonic - but it's lowercase-L and 0!

command.name: storesets
command.description: Generates an alias (list) of the current values for the given aliases/CVARs.

argument.description: the alias to store them in

command.name: alias
command.description: Binds a name to commands.

example.code: alias myalias [ echo "hello world"; alias myalias [ echo "I already said hello" ] ]
example.explanation: It is possible to re-bind an alias, even during its evaluation.
There is also the shorthand version of defining an alias via the "=" sign.

command.name: const
command.description: Set an alias as a constant.

remarks.remark: A constant cannot be redefined in the same AC session: its value cannot be changed. To get rid of a constant, use "delalias".
Constant alias is temporary that will not be written to saved.cfg, and thus will not persist after quitting.

example.explanation: Set "myalias" value to "myvalue" then "lock" it as a constant.
You can directly set a value for your alias when you define it as a constant.
Assigning a value to a const will throw you an error. Output: myalias is already defined as a constant

command.name: enumalias
command.description: Lists all persistent aliases that start with prefix.

remarks.remark: Returns a table with two entries per alias: 1) full name and 2) name without prefix.

command.name: checkalias
command.description: Determines if the argument given is an existing alias or not.

command.name: isconst
command.description: Determines if the argument given is a constant or not.

command.name: checkinit
command.description: Ensures the initialization of an alias.

example.explanation: Output: if alias mapstartalways does not exist, this command initializes it.

example.code: checkinit mapstartalways [ echo New map, good luck! ]
example.explanation: Output: if alias mapstartalways does not exist, it is initialized, and if the block of code "[ echo New map, good luck! ]" does not exist within the aliases contents, this command adds it.

argument.description: the block of code to ensure that the alias contains

command.name: check2init
command.description: Defines an alias only if it does not already exist.

command.name: delalias
command.description: Deletes the passed alias.

command.name: forceinit
command.description: Forcibly sets a list of aliases to a specified value.

command.name: aliasinit
command.description: Initializes a group of aliases using checkinit.

argument.description: the list of aliases to check for
the block of code to ensure the aliases contain

command.name: check2initlist
command.description: Uses check2init on a list of aliases.

command.name: persistidents
command.description: Controls whether aliases defined afterwards will be saved (1) or not (0).

remarks.remark: Rules:
* aliases created by "const" and "tempalias" are never persistent;
* aliases created or altered by "alias" or "=" become persistent, if the "persistidents" flag is set during that operation;

* "persistidents" is false during the execution of almost all config files during game start - those files can create aliases with default values which will not be persistent (until changed later while the flag is set);

* before saved.cfg is executed, the flag is set and stays set all throughout the game - which means, that all changes (for example from menus or in console) will change the altered alias to "persistent";
* exceptions for map or model config files are unnecessary, since those run restricted and can't create aliases anyway;
* exceptions are necessary for "late run" config files like those in config/opt/ folder.

This command may be used to manually set or clear the flag. It also returns the current state of the flag. If used in a config file, the flag is restored to its original value when the file ends execution.

In short: only late-run config files (meaning: run after saved.cfg was restored) may need to manually set/reset the flag. Use "const" and "tempalias" where appropriate and clear "persistidents" before creating an alias with a not-to-save default value that may be changed and made persistent later.

example.explanation: foo will not be saved and has to be redefined when restarting AC.
bar will be saved and persistent across sessions.

command.name: addpunct
command.description: Injects cubescript punctuation.

command.name: tolower
command.description: Converts a string to all lowercase characters.

command.name: toupper
command.description: Converts a string to all uppercase characters.

command.name: testchar
command.description: Tests a character argument for various things.

example.explanation: Output: 1 // It is a a-z or A-Z character
Output: 1 // It is a a-z or A-Z character or 0-9 digit
Output: 1 // It is a lowercase a-z character
Output: 1 // It is a uppercase A-Z character
Output: 1 // It is a printable character
Output: 1 // It is a punctuation character
Output: 1 // It is a whitespace character

remarks.remark: See the following c++ functions for more information about the usage of this command:
isalpha(), isalnum(), isdigit(), islower(), isprint(), ispunct(), isupper(), and isspace()

command.name: strreplace
command.description: Returns a string, with a portion of it replaced with a new sub-string.

argument.description: the new sub-string to replace the target

command.name: listaverage
command.description: Returns the average of a list of numbers.

scriptalias.name: add2alias
scriptalias.description: This will append the passed 2nd argument to any existing content of the alias named in the 1st argument.

remarks.remark: Several popular aliases have predefined shortcuts using this scriptalias: addOnLoadOnce, addOnLoadAlways. Check config/scripts.cfg for possible omissions in that list.

example.code: foo = "one" add2alias foo two echo foo
example.explanation: This will output the string and override any other actions that might've been defined.

scriptalias.name: add2list
scriptalias.description: Appends a new element to a list.

example.code: tmp_list = []; add2list tmp_list Hello; add2list tmp_list world!; echo $tmp_list

command.name: listoptions
command.description: Lists the argument options for several argument types.

example.explanation: Output: "entities ents weapons teamnames teamnames-abbrv punctuations crosshairnames menufilesortorders texturestacktypes cubetypes"

command.name: escape
command.description: Replaces control characters in a string with escaped sequences.

command.name: tempalias
command.description: Creates a temporary alias that will not be written to saved.cfg, and thus will not persist after quitting.

command.name: editsvar
command.description: Interactively edits an existing alias in the console buffer.

remarks.remark: This takes the current value of the existing alias, and inserts it into the command line / text entry box.

command.name: editalias
command.description: Interactively edits an alias in the console buffer.

remarks.remark: This takes the current value of the alias, and inserts it into the command line / text entry box.
If the alias doesn't exist, it is created.

command.name: inputcommand
command.description: Makes an input perform a certain command.

remarks.remark: It opens a custom console buffer with custom prompt, initial buffer text and execution script (which gets the input buffer content in alias cmdbuf). If "nopersist" is not zero, the command will not be stored in console history.

command.name: sortlist
command.description: Returns a sorted version of a list.

command.name: isolatecontext
command.description: Isolates the given context.

remarks.remark: This disables access from this context to identifiers located in other contexts, also it removes all aliases created in this context once the running context changes.

command.name: sealcontexts
command.description: Secures this configuration for the rest of the game.

argument.description: Text to put in the clipboard.

variable.name: autoscreenshot
variable.description: Toggle for taking an automatic screenshot during intermission.

variable.name: screenshottype
variable.description: Toggle format of screenshot image. Your choice is for BMP (0), JPEG (1) or PNG (2).

variable.name: screenshotscale
variable.description: Scales screenshots by the given factor before saving. 1 = original size, 0.5 = half size, etc.

command.name: getscrext
command.description: Returns the file extension of the client's current screenshottype setting.

variable.name: jpegquality
variable.description: Sets the JPEG screenshot image quality.

remarks.remark: The image quality is set by it's compression level, a value of 10 sets maximum compression and a small file size but results in a bad quality image
while a value of 100 results in a large file but gives the best quality image.

variable.name: pngcompress
variable.description: Sets the PNG screenshot file compression.

remarks.remark: A value of 9 sets maximum data compression and a smaller file size while a value of 0 results in a large file image, quality is always the same since PNG its a loosless format.

command.name: writecfg
command.description: Writes current configuration to config/saved.cfg - automatic on quit.

command.name: echo
command.description: Outputs text to the console.

command.name: hudecho
command.description: Outputs text to the console and heads up display.

variable.name: allowhudechos
variable.description: Enables or disables the ability of hudecho to output text to the heads up display.

command.name: saycommand
command.description: Puts a prompt on screen.

remarks.remark: This puts a prompt on screen that you can type into, and will capture all keystrokes until you press return (or ESC to cancel). If what you typed started with a "/", the rest of it will be executed as a command, otherwise its something you "say" to all players.

key.description: opens a command prompt % (for team chat)

key.name: left Shift + Esc
key.description: resets the commandline to the state before using TAB-completion

variableArgument.description: the text to display in the prompt

remarks.remark: The completion will work on the first word of your console input.

example.explanation: If you enter "/demo " and press TAB you will cycle through all available demos.
Helper alias for quickly adding complete-definitions for all gamemodes - see config/script.cfg (below "Auto-completions").

command.name: debugargs
command.description: Dumps all command arguments to STDOUT.

variable.name: physinterp
variable.description: Toggles physics interpolation.

command.name: millis
command.description: Returns the number of milliseconds since engine start.

command.name: systime
command.description: Seconds since the epoch (00:00:00 UTC on January 1, 1970).

command.name: timestamp
command.description: A list of values for current time.

remarks.remark: Format: YYYY mm dd HH MM SS

command.name: datestring
command.description: Representation of date.

remarks.remark: Format: Www Mmm dd hh:mm:ss yyyy
Use timestamp to create your own formatting.

command.name: timestring
command.description: The current time in (H)H:MM:SS format.

command.name: quit
command.description: Quits the game without asking.

command.name: screenshot
command.description: Takes a screenshot.

remarks.remark: Screenshots are saved to "screenshots/[date]_[time]_[map]_[mode].[ext]", where [ext] is the image type selected.

command.name: cleanshot
command.description: Takes a "clean" screenshot with no HUD items.

remarks.remark: Your current HUD configuration is stored into a buffer, and is re-enabled afterwards.

command.name: mapshot
command.description: Saves an image of the entire radar-overview of the map.

command.name: exec
command.description: Executes all commands in a specified config file.

remarks.remark: It also allows to pass arguments to and deliver results from script files - when a script file is executed, any additional arguments are passed as execarg1..execargX to the script. The number of arguments is in execnumargs and if the script in the file sets the value of execresult, the exec command returns that value.
Example:
if there is a file testscript.cfg with this content: execresult = (* $execarg1 $execarg2)
then the command: "echo (exec testscript.cfg 6 7)" will output "42".

command.name: execdir
command.description: Executes all commands in all config files in the specified directory.

argument.description: the directory path from the assaultcube root

command.name: run
command.description: Executes a config file within "config" folder.

command.name: resetsecuremaps
command.description: Clears the list of secured maps.

command.name: securemap
command.description: Adds a map to the list of secured maps.

remarks.remark: Secured maps can not be overwritten by the commands sendmap and getmap.

command.name: getEngineState
command.description: Returns a list of values describing the current engine (rendering) state.

remarks.remark: It will only be filled after the first frame was drawn.
The list is: FPS LOD WQD WVT EVT
FPS = Frames Per Second
LOD = Level Of Detail
WQD = World QuaD Count
WVT = World VerTex Count
EVT = Extra VerTex Count (HUD & menu)

variable.name: networkdebug
variable.description: Enables output of processed network packets.

remarks.remark: This variable only has an effect if the client binary is compiled in debug mode.

variable.name: autogetmap
variable.description: Determines if the current played map should be automatically downloaded if it is not available locally.

variable.name: autogetnewmaprevisions
variable.description: Automatically get new map revisions from the server.

variable.name: clockerror
variable.description: Sets the correction value for clockfix.

remarks.remark: Engine source-code snippet (main.cpp): if(clockfix) millis = int(millis*(double(clockerror)/1000000));

variable.name: clockfix
variable.description: Enables correction of the system clock.

variable.name: resetcfg
variable.description: Determines if all settings should be reset when the game quits.

remarks.remark: It is recommended to quit the game immediately after enabling this setting. Note that the reset happens only once as the value of this variable is reset as well.

variable.name: throttle_accel
variable.description: Determines how fast network throttling accelerates.

variable.name: throttle_decel
variable.description: Determines how fast network throttling decelerates.

variable.name: throttle_interval
variable.description: Determines the interval of re-evaluating network throttling.

variable.name: version
variable.description: Gets an integer representing the game version. READ ONLY

remarks.remark: As example, version 1.2.0.2 is represented as value 1202.

command.name: current_version
command.description: Compare given version to current version.

remarks.remark: Will show update notifications if the given version is higher than the running one.

variable.name: protocol
variable.description: Gets an integer representing the game protocol. READ ONLY

remarks.remark: As example, the protocol of version 1.2.0.2 is represented as value 1201.

variable.name: connected
variable.description: Indicates if a connection to a server exists.

variable.name: numconlines
variable.description: Hold the current number of lines on the console.

variable.name: conline
variable.description: Returns text from the last line in the console.

variable.name: lang
variable.description: Sets the language for which a translated server MOTD will be fetched, if the server has one for this language.

remarks.remark: This is always a two-letter language code as defined in the ISO 639 standard, three-letter codes are currently not allowed.
If lang is not set, or if the server does not have a matching MOTD file, it will fall back to English.
Note: this does not affect the client language, which is derived from the system settings (e.g. on many *nix systems, it may be changed via the "LANG" environment variable).

variable.name: applydialog
variable.description: Toggles the showing of the "Apply changes now?" menu when changing certain graphical settings.

variable.name: conopen
variable.description: Indicates the state of the console.

value.valueNotes: 0: closed, 1: open in an alternate size, 2: open regularly

command.name: history
command.description: Executes the specified command in the command line history.

remarks.remark: For example, binding "history 1" to a key allows you to quickly repeat the last command typed in (useful for placing many identical entities etc.)

argument.description: the N'th command from the history

command.name: conskip
command.description: Allows to browse through the console history by offsetting the console output.

variable.name: maxhistory
variable.description: Sets how many typed console commands to store.

remarks.remark: This value sets how many command lines to store in memory, everytime a command is entered it gets store so it can be recalled using the "/" key along with the arrow keys to scroll back and forth through the list.

variable.name: maxcon
variable.description: Sets the total number of text lines from the console to store as history.

variable.name: omitunchangeddefaults
variable.description: Omit variables with unchanged default values from saved.cfg.

remarks.remark: If this value is 1, variables that are at their default values are omitted from saved.cfg. If 0, the variables are written to saved.cfg, but commented out.

variable.name: groupvariables
variable.description: Controls how many variables (with similar names) are grouped together on one line in saved.cfg.

remarks.remark: This only pertains to commented variables in saved.cfg caused by omitunchangeddefaults being 0.

variable.name: omitunchangeddefaultbinds
variable.description: Omit unchanged default binds from saved.cfg.

value.description: 0 = print; 1 = print, but commented out; 2 = omit

command.name: addpckserver
command.description: Adds a packages source server where to download custom content from.

remarks.remark: Only add servers you trust.
The list of servers is saved into config/pcksources.cfg on game quit.
If a priority is given, it influences the sorting of servers. Servers with higher priority are queried first. If servers have the same priority, they are sorted by ping. Default priority is zero.

argument.description: The server address. Trailing slash not needed.

command.name: getpckserver
command.description: Returns a table with four columns of all configured package servers.

remarks.remark: The columns are: host name, priority, ping and resolved. "resolved" is a flag, indicating, if the server answered the ping during game start.

command.name: resetpckservers
command.description: Resets the list of packages source servers where to download custom content from.

remarks.remark: Restart AssaultCube to take the effect.

variable.name: autodownload
variable.description: Determines if the game should try to download missing packages such as textures or mapmodels on the fly.

value.description: Note: This is turned on by default

variable.name: autodownloaddebug
variable.description: When the variable autodownloaddebug is set to 1 and/or in debug binaries, more debug output is produced.

command.name: addzipmod
command.description: Add the zip package file "mods/zipname.zip" to the virtual file system.

remarks.remark: Add the zip package file "mods/zipname.zip" to the virtual file system. Only files below the path "packages/" are added (and also files below "config/", if zipname starts with "###"). If the size of the zip file is below "zipcachemaxsize", the whole zip file is cached in memory. (Un-cached zip files are kept open at all time, so caching keeps the number of simultaneously opened files lower.)

argument.description: the name of the zip mod

variable.name: zipcachemaxsize
variable.description: Maximal size of the file, which is cached in memory.

remarks.remark: If the size of the zip file is below "zipcachemaxsize", then during loading the whole zip file is cached in memory. When the size is greater, then zip is just opened as a file and read from disk.

command.name: zipmodremove
command.description: Removes one zip file from the virtual file system.

argument.description: the name of the zip mod

command.name: zipmodclear
command.description: Removes all zip files from the virtual file system.

command.name: zipmodlist
command.description: Lists zip files in "mods/".

remarks.remark: By default or if "what" is "all", all zips are listed. If "what" is "active", only those zips, that are already in use, are listed. If "what" is "inactive", only the unused zip files are listed.

command.name: zipmodgetdesc
command.description: Reads and returns the first 11 lines from the file "desc.txt" in the named zip file.

remarks.remark: The first line is supposed to contain a descriptive title for the zip (for use in menus) and the next 10 lines should contain a more detailed description (also for use in menus). The command also unpacks "preview.jpg" from the zip and mounts it as a temporary file under the name "packages/modpreviews/zipname.jpg".

argument.description: the name of the zip mod

command.name: zipmodgetfiles
command.description: Returns the list of files contained in a zip file.

argument.description: the name of the zip mod

command.name: zipmodgetrevision
command.description: Returns the revision number of the zip file.

remarks.remark: The number is supposed to be part of a filename: "revision_n". If no such file is found in the zip file, the return value is zero. The content of the revision file is not relevant and a file size of zero is recommended.

argument.description: the name of the zip mod

command.name: demonameformat
command.description: Sets the formatstring for demo filenames.

remarks.remark: we use the following internal mapping of formatchars:
%g : gamemode (int) ; %G : gamemode (chr) ; %F : gamemode (full) ;
%m : minutes remaining ; %M : minutes played ;
%s : seconds remaining ; %S : seconds played ;
%h : IP of server ; %H : hostname of server (client only) ;
%n : mapname ;
%w : timestamp "when" (formatted by demotimeformat) .

command.name: demotimeformat
command.description: Sets the formatstring for demo timestamp.

remarks.remark: If the string starts with 'U', UTC is used - otherwise local time.
The same format options as in strftime().

scriptalias.name: afterinit
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed after saved.cfg is loaded.

scriptalias.name: autoexec
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed after autoexec.cfg is loaded.

command.name: enumfiles
command.description: Lists files in a directory.

remarks.remark: If extension is specified, only files of that extension are listed.
If the extension is "dir", only directories are listed.

variable.name: dbgzip
variable.description: Output statistics and errors when handling zip compressed data.

remarks.remark: Advanced usage: may be helpful in debugging map files not loading.

variable.name: debugevents
variable.description: Whether or not to output input events.

remarks.remark: If set to at least 1 all events will output their type number. Window events and mouse button/wheel events will output status information.
If set to 2 the KEYUP, TEXTINPUT and MOUSEMOVE events will trigger status output too.

variable.name: disconnectonmaperror
variable.description: Disconnect from a server making us load an incompatible map.

remarks.remark: Maps that have not been converted to the new entity attribute scaling map format can cause this.
Edit it offline and make use of the config/opt/convmap.cfg.

section.name: Gameplay
section.description: This section describes gameplay related identifiers.

scriptalias.name: start_intermission
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run when the game reaches intermission.

example.explanation: This will output the full statistics line for all players.

scriptalias.name: mapstartonce
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run when the game starts a new map, then it is deleted.

example.explanation: This will output the string and override any other actions that might've been defined.
This will output the string after any previously defined actions have run.

scriptalias.name: mapstartalways
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time the game starts a new map.

example.explanation: This will output the string and override any other actions that might've been defined.
This will output the string after any previously defined actions have run.

scriptalias.name: onCallVote
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time a vote is called.

scriptalias.name: onChangeVote
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time a vote is changed.

scriptalias.name: onVoteEnd
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists it will be run every time a vote passes or fails.

variable.name: votepending
variable.description: Determines if there is a vote pending or not.

example.explanation: Output: if there is currently a vote pending, returns 1, else returns 0.

scriptalias.name: onKill
scriptalias.description: If it exists, this alias will be executing when any player get killed, receiving a few arguments.

argument.description: The client number of the actor
The client number of the target
The number of the gun used
Is it a gib or a normal frag

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onFlag

argument.valueNotes: integer (0 = stolen, 1 = dropped, 2 = lost, 3 = returned, 4 = scored, 5 = ktfscore, 6 = failed to score, 7 = reset)

argument.description: The client number of the actor

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time a flag action occurs.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onPickup

argument.description: The item that was picked up
argument.valueNotes: integer (0 = pistol clips, 1 = ammo box, 2 = grenade, 3 = health, 4 = helmet, 5 = armour, 6 = akimbo)

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time you pick up an item.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onAttack
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time you shot a bullet, throw a grenade or use your knife.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onHit

argument.description: The client number of the actor
The client number of the target
The number of the gun used
Is it a gib or a normal frag

scriptalias.description: If it's defined, this alias will be executed each time a damage is done.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onWeaponSwitch

argument.description: The weapon number that you switched to

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time you switch to a different weapon.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onReload
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time you reload a weapon.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onConnect

argument.description: The client number of the player who connected

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed when you or another player join(s) a server.

scriptalias.name: onDisconnect

argument.description: The client number of the player who disconnected

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed when you or another player disconnect(s) from a server.

scriptalias.name: onSpawn

argument.description: The client number of the player who spawned

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed each time a player spawns.

remarks.remark: Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onNameChange

argument.description: The client number of the player who changed name
The new name of the client

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed when you or another player change(s) his name.

remarks.remark: The alias is executed before the name is effectively changed, so you can still get the previous name of the client from this alias.
Remark: it works only in singleplayer.

scriptalias.name: onPM

argument.description: The client number who sent you private message

scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed when another player sent you private message.

command.name: pstat_weap
command.description: Returns the shot statistics for the player with the given clientnumber.

example.explanation: The output is a list of tuples for all weapons, SHOTS-FIRED and DAMAGE-DEALT for each.

remarks.remark: The list is:
knife/atk dmg pistol/atk dmg carbine/atk dmg shotgun/atk dmg smg/atk dmg sniper/atk dmg assault/atk dmg nade/atk dmg akimbo/atk dmg

command.name: shiftweapon
command.description: Shifts your selected weapon by a given delta.

remarks.remark: By default the mouse-wheel shifts one up or down according to your scroll direction.

command.name: setscope
command.description: Displays a scope for the sniper-rifle.

remarks.remark: It is used in the zoom-script (config/scripts.cfg: "const zoom").

command.name: togglespect
command.description: Cycles through all available spectator modes.

remarks.remark: These modes are: Follow-1stPerson, Follow-3rdPerson, Follow-3rdPerson-transparent and Fly.

command.name: whois
command.description: Get the IP address of a given clientnumber - only admins get shown the last octet.

command.name: vote
command.description: Agree or disagree to the currently running vote.

command.name: gonext
command.description: Go to the next match in the servers rotation for the desired gamemode.

remarks.remark: TODO: elaborate

command.name: setnext
command.description: Call a vote for mode and map.

remarks.remark: TODO: elaborate

key.description: opens the voicecom menu, use number keys for your choice

variable.name: voicecomsounds
variable.description: Enables or disables voicecom audio.

argument.valueNotes: 2 (only play voicecom audio from you and your teammates)

command.name: loadcrosshair
command.description: Loads a crosshair for given type.

example.explanation: Loads the red_dot.png crosshair for all weapons.
Same as above. Loads the red_dot.png crosshair for all weapons.
Loads the red_dot.png crosshair for your knife only.
Loads the red_dot.png crosshair for your assault rifle only.
Loads the red_dot.png crosshair for your sniper rifle scope only.
Loads all default crosshairs (including teammate and scope).

argument.valueNotes: default, teammate, scope, edit, knife, pistol, carbine, shotgun, subgun, sniper, assault, grenade, akimbo, reset

command.name: listdemos
command.description: Get the game demos listing from the server we are currently connected.

command.name: getdemo
command.description: Gets the recorded demo from a game on the server.

remarks.remark: If F10 is pressed earlier than two minutes into the game, the last game will be downloaded.
If F10 is pressed later than two minutes into the game, the current game is scheduled to be automatically downloaded when it ends.

command.name: dropflag
command.description: Drops the taken flag.

command.name: crouch
command.description: Triggers a crouch.

command.name: jump
command.description: Triggers a jump.

command.name: spectatecn
command.description: Returns client number of spectated player.

command.name: teaminfo
command.description: Returns attributes of a team.

argument.valueNotes: Valid attributes: flags, frags, deaths, points, name, players

command.name: curmap
command.description: Returns the current map being played.

variable.name: curmaprevision
variable.description: Current map revision number.

command.name: curmastermode
command.description: Returns the server's current mastermode state.

command.name: curautoteam
command.description: Returns the server's current autoteam state.

command.name: curpausemode
command.description: Returns the server's current pause state (1=paused, 0=resumed).

command.name: currentprimary
command.description: Returns the weapon-index the local player currently has selected as primary.

remarks.remark: This is not the same as curweapon - which could be a grenade or the knife.

command.name: hasprimary
command.description: Determines if the local player (you) are currently carrying a primary weapon.

example.code: add2bind MOUSE1 [ if (hasprimary) [ echo you attacked with a primary weapon ] ]
example.explanation: Everytime you press the left mouse button, assuming you are carrying your primary weapon, the above echo will be executed.

remarks.remark: Returns 0 (false) or 1 (true).

command.name: curserver
command.description: Returns information on the current server - if you're connected to one.

remarks.remark: If I is 0 (omitted or any other value than the ones below) you will get a string with 'IP PORT'
If I is 1,2 or 3 you will get the IP, HostName or port respectively.
If I is 4 you get a string representing the current state of the peer - usually this should be 'connected'.
If I is 5 you will get a server name.
If I is 6 or 7 you will get a server description.
If I is 8, you will get a serverbrowser-line with the server - this is handled with caution, sometimes empty, #8 will be outdated w/o serverbrowser open.

example.explanation: Output: I am connected to ctf-only.assault-servers.net

example.code: last_server = "" remember_server = [ if (strcmp (curserver 4) "connected") [ last_server = (curserver 0) echo "I'm remembering:" $last_server ] [ echo "you are not 'connected' - you" (concatword "are '" (curserver 4) "' !") ] ] bind PRINT [ if (strcmp $last_server "") [ remember_server ] [ say (concat "^L2I was just ^Lfon^L3" $last_server) last_server = "" ] ]
example.explanation: This will either remember or retrieve the last server you pressed the PrintScreen-key on.

command.name: curweapon
command.description: Returns the weapon-index the local player is currently holding.

command.name: prevweapon
command.description: Returns the weapon-index the local player was previously holding.

command.name: map
command.description: Loads up a map in the gamemode set previously by the 'mode' command.

remarks.remark: If connected to a multiplayer server, it votes to load the map (others will have to type "map M" as well to agree with loading this map). To vote for a map with a specific mode, set the mode before you issue the map command.

A map given as "blah" refers to "packages/maps/blah.cgz", "mypackage/blah" refers to "packages/mypackage/blah.cgz". At every map load, "config/default_map_settings.cfg" is loaded which sets up all texture definitions, etc. Everything defined there can be overridden per package or per map by creating a "mapname.cfg" which contains whatever you want to do differently from the default.

When the map finishes it will load the next map when one is defined, otherwise it reloads the current map. You can define what map follows a particular map by making an alias like (in the map script): alias nextmap_blah1 blah2 (loads "blah2" after "blah1").

argument.description: Name of the map to load

command.name: votemap
command.description: Sets the next gamemode then calls a vote for a map.

command.name: loadmap
command.description: Loads a map directly in the current gamemode (singleplayer only).

variable.name: nextprimary
variable.description: Sets the primary weapon on next respawn.

command.name: reload
command.description: Reloads the weapon.

command.name: name
command.description: Sets the nick name for the local player.

variable.name: curname
variable.description: Returns the nick name of the local player.

command.name: say
command.description: Outputs text to other players.

remarks.remark: If the text begins with a percent character (%), only team mates will receive the message.

command.name: pm
command.description: Sends a private message to a specified client.

variable.name: lastpm
variable.description: Holds the CN of the last client who sent you a private message.

remarks.remark: If you haven't recieved any private messages, 'lastpm' is -1

command.name: quickanswer
command.description: Easily respond the last client who sent you a private message.

command.name: ignore
command.description: Ignore a player.

remarks.remark: You won't see any further game chat or hear any more voice com messages from that player.

command.name: listignored
command.description: Print a list of all players that you are currently ignoring.

command.name: clearignored
command.description: Clear list of ignored players.

argument.description: client number, or -1 to clear the whole list

remarks.remark: Omit the client number to clear the whole list.

command.name: ignoreall
command.description: Ignore all clients currently on the server.

command.name: unignoreall
command.description: Unignore all clients currently on the server.

command.name: ignoreteam
command.description: Ignore all clients on the specified team.

command.name: ignoreenemy
command.description: Ignore all clients on the enemy team.

command.name: muteplayer
command.description: Mutes a player.

remarks.remark: You won't hear any further voice com messages from that player.

command.name: clearmuted
command.description: Clears a list of muted players.

argument.description: client number, or -1 to clear the whole list

remarks.remark: Omit the client number to clear the whole list.

command.name: listmuted
command.description: Prints a list of all players that you have muted.

command.name: me
command.description: Action chat message.

command.name: nickcomplete
command.description: Adds a command to complete nicknames on.

remarks.remark: Your own nick will be ignored.

example.explanation: with this you can enter "/nickgreet " and cycle via TAB to the nickname you want to greet.

command.name: connect
command.description: Connects to a server.

remarks.remark: If the server name is omitted, the client will try to connect to an available server in the LAN. If the port is omitted or set to 0, the default port will be used.

argument.description: the address of the server (hostname or IP)

command.name: connectadmin
command.description: Connects to a server and tries to claim admin state.

remarks.remark: This command will connect to a server just like the command 'connect' and try to claim admin state. If the specified password is correct, the admin will be able to connect even if he is locked out by ban, private master mode or taken client slots. If successfully connected, bans assigned to the admin's host will be removed automatically. If all client slots are taken a random client will be kicked to let the admin in.
If the server name ist omitted, the client will try to connect to an available server in the LAN. If the port is omitted or set to 0, the default port will be used.

example.explanation: connect as admin on port 777 of localhost
will try to connect to a LAN server on the default port as admin with the given password of "myAdminPassword".

argument.description: the address of the server (hostname or IP)

command.name: disconnect
command.description: Leaves a server.

command.name: reconnect
command.description: Disconnects then reconnects you to the current server.

command.name: lanconnect
command.description: Tries to connect to a LAN server.

command.name: team
command.description: Sets the team for the local player.

variable.name: changeteam
variable.description: Swaps your player to the enemy team.

command.name: benchme
command.description: Moves from active team to spectator during match.

command.name: modconnect
command.description: Connects to a modded server.

remarks.remark: The modified server needs to use the original client-server protocol. The protocol version number will be the negated value of an unmodded server.

command.name: modconnectadmin
command.description: Connects to a modded server and tries to claim admin state.

remarks.remark: The modified server needs to use the original client-server protocol. The protocol version number will be the negated value of an unmodded server.

command.name: modlanconnect
command.description: Tries to connect to a modified LAN server.

remarks.remark: The modified server needs to use the original client-server protocol. The protocol version number will be the negated value of an unmodded server.

variable.name: akimboautoswitch
variable.description: Whether or not to automatically switch to akimbo upon pickup.

remarks.remark: If you are brandishing your pistol while walking over the pickup you will switch to akimbo every time.

command.name: weapon
command.description: Changes the weapon (must be bound to a key).

command.name: primary
command.description: Switches to your current primary weapon (must be bound to a key).

command.name: secondary
command.description: Switches to your secondary weapon (must be bound to a key).

command.name: melee
command.description: Switches to knife (must be bound to a key).

key.name: middle mouse button
key.description: switches to knife and attacks (if the key is held)

command.name: grenades
command.description: Switches to grenades, if available (must be bound to a key).

remarks.remark: See also "quicknadethrow" command.

command.name: sndtoggle
command.description: Toggles between your primary weapon and secondary weapon (must be bound to a key).

command.name: knftoggle
command.description: Toggles between your primary weapon and knife (must be bound to a key).

command.name: gndtoggle
command.description: Toggles between your primary weapon and grenades (must be bound to a key).

command.name: magcontent
command.description: Returns contents of current magazine.

remarks.remark: A knife will always return 1.
Weapons that aren't available will return -1.

command.name: magreserve
command.description: Returns contents of magazine reserve.

command.name: checkmag
command.description: Determines if you have any ammunition available for the specified weapon. (uses magcontent and magreserve)

command.name: getmap
command.description: Retrieves the last map that was sent to the server using 'sendmap'.

remarks.remark: If the command is passed an argument, different than the map being played, the game tries to download the specified map from an available packages source server.

argument.description: cubescript to execute once map is installed

command.name: dlmap
command.description: Downloads and loads the specified map from an available packages source server.

command.name: getmod
command.description: Try to download mods/modname.zip from all configured package servers.

remarks.remark: Does not automatically activate the mod.

command.name: spectatemode
command.description: Sets the desired spectating mode.

command.name: spectate
command.description: Toggles spectator mode.

variable.name: spectatepersistent
variable.description: Enables persistent spectating concrete player.

remarks.remark: For "spectatepersistent" = 1 persistent spectating is enabled in all game modes in multiplayer (that means, that spectated player isn't changed after his death), for "0" it is enabled only in non-arena modes.

value.description: 0: enabled in non-arena modes, 1: always enabled

command.name: stopdemo
command.description: Stops demo playback.

command.name: watchingdemo
command.description: Returns 1 when the current game is being played from a demo, else 0.

example.code: echo I am (at [not now] (watchingdemo)) watching a demo. "so, are you?"

command.name: suicide
command.description: Kills your player. You will lose 1 frag point and receive 1 death point when using this command.

command.name: demo
command.description: Plays a recorded demo.

remarks.remark: Playback is interpolated for the player whose perspective you view.

command.name: setmr
command.description: Go to a predefined number of minutes before the end of the game while watching a demo.

argument.description: the minutes remaining to skip to

command.name: rewind
command.description: Rewind the current demo to S seconds ago.

remarks.remark: Note: you can use a negative value to forward.

argument.description: the number of seconds to rewind

variable.name: curdemofile
variable.description: Returns the name of played demo.

variable.name: minutesremaining
variable.description: Returns the remaining minutes of the currently played game. READ ONLY

variable.name: gametimecurrent
variable.description: Returns the time (in milliseconds) of the currently played game. READ ONLY

example.code: showtime = [ if (> $lastgametimeupdate 0) [ gmr = (- $gametimemaximum (+ $gametimecurrent (- (millis) $lastgametimeupdate))) gsr = (div $gmr 1000) gts = (mod $gsr 60) if (< $gts 10) [ gts = (concatword 0 $gts) ] [ ] gtm = (div $gsr 60) if (< $gtm 10) [ gtm = (concatword 0 $gtm) ] [ ] echo (concatword $gtm : $gts) remaining ] [ echo gametime not updated yet ] ]

variable.name: gametimemaximum
variable.description: Returns the maximum time (in milliseconds) of the currently played game. READ ONLY

variable.name: gametimestart
variable.description: Returns the time (in milliseconds) when the last map was loaded.

variable.name: lastgametimeupdate
variable.description: Returns the last time (in milliseconds) the gametime was updated. READ ONLY

variable.name: paused
variable.description: Determines if the singleplayer game should be paused.

command.name: pause
command.description: Vote to pause or resume the match.

remarks.remark: This command is only supported on servers that are in 'match' mastermode.
You can use the alias 'togglepause' to switch between pause and resume.

variable.name: autoreload
variable.description: Indicates if the weapons should be reloaded automatically.

variable.name: scopefov
variable.description: Determines the FOV when scoping.

variable.name: gamespeed
variable.description: Sets the gamespeed in percent.

remarks.remark: This does not work in multiplayer.

variable.name: flyspeed
variable.description: Determines by how much to multiply the fly speeds by.

variable.name: akimboendaction
variable.description: Sets the behavior of weapon switching upon akimbo expiration.

remarks.remark: If no ammunition is detected for the target weapon, it will fallback to the previous weapon until it finds a weapon with ammunition to use.

command.name: drawzone
command.description: Draws a zone marker with the specified color and dimensions on the minimap/radar.

remarks.remark: This is primarily intended for the survival mode.
You can draw a few zones at a time. They will be reset (i.e. removed) once a new game starts.
Note that the coordinates must be specified as integers, not as floating-point values.

argument.description: a color for the zone, in hexadecimal notation

command.name: resetzones
command.description: Reset all drawn zones.

scriptalias.name: onLastMin
scriptalias.description: If this alias exists, it will be automatically executed on the last minute remaining mark.

command.name: curplayers
command.description: Returns the size of the players vector.

remarks.remark: The return value includes the local player "(you)" and works in both singleplayer and multiplayer scenarios. It can be used, for example, in a loop to find all valid clients (players) on server. Note: it DOESN'T return current number of players.

command.name: isclient
command.description: Determines if the client number given is a valid client (player).

command.name: findcn
command.description: Finds client number (cn) of player with given name.

command.name: highestcn
command.description: Returns the highest valid client number available.

command.name: quicknadethrow
command.description: Switches to grenades, if available (must be bound to a key).

remarks.remark: If grenades are already selected or the key is held, it throws a grenade and switches back to previous weapon.

key.name: right mouse button
key.description: for all weapons except sniper rifle

command.name: forward
command.description: Moves the player forward.

command.name: backward
command.description: Moves the player backward.

command.name: left
command.description: Moves the player left.

command.name: right
command.description: Moves the player right.

command.name: attack
command.description: Fires the current weapon.

command.name: whereami
command.description: Prints the local client's (x,y) coordinates.

command.name: burstshots
command.description: Sets the firing mode of automatic weapons between full auto mode and burst fire mode.

argument.valueNotes: Special values: 0: set weapon to full auto, -1: don't set, instead check and return shots per burst

command.name: winners
command.description: Returns the team number with the highest score, or if in a non-team mode, returns the CN of the player with the highest score.

command.name: fragmessage
command.description: Sets the frag message corresponding to a weapon (appearing on the hud).

argument.description: the message you want to appear

example.explanation: It will display "you sniped unarmed" on the hud when you frag unarmed with sniper.

command.name: gibmessage
command.description: Sets the gib message corresponding to a weapon (appearing on the hud).

argument.description: the message you want to appear

remarks.remark: This command is identical to fragmessage, please see it.

command.name: player
command.description: Retrieve an attribute of a player identified by clientnum.

remarks.remark: If the clientnum does not match a valid player the result will be empty, just as without an attribute passed.

The following attributes can be retrieved: magcontent, ammo, primary, curweapon, nextprimary, health, armour, attacking, scoping, x, y, z, name, team, ping, pj, state, role, frags, flags, deaths, tks, alive, spect, cn, skin_cla, skin_rvsf, skin, ip

command.name: player1
command.description: Retrieve an attribute of yourself.

remarks.remark: See player for all retrievable attributes.

section.name: Keyboard and mouse
section.description: This section describes keyboard and mouse related identifiers.

command.name: bind
command.description: Binds a key to a command.

remarks.remark: To find out what key names and their default bindings are, look at config/keymap.cfg, then add bind commands to your autoexec.cfg.

command.name: editbind
command.description: Similar to bind, but is only active while editing, where it overrides the regular bind for the specified key.

command.name: specbind
command.description: Similar to bind, but is only active while spectating, where it overrides the regular bind for the specified key.

command.name: megabind
command.description: Binds a key to many different actions depending on the current game state.

example.code: megabind F9 [echo Demo!] [echo Editing or coop!] [echo Connected!] [echo Bots!] [echo Other!]

argument.description: body of code to execute if watching a demo
body of code to execute if editing or in coop-edit mode
body of code to execute if connected to a server
body of code to execute if in a bot mode
body of code to execute if none of the other arguments have been met

remarks.remark: This command requires 6 arguments, no less. Use an empty set of brackets [] for any of the arguments that you want to "do nothing".

command.name: onrelease
command.description: Executes a command on the release of a key/button.

remarks.remark: This command must be placed in an action in a bind or in an alias in a bind.

example.code: bind CTRL [ echo "key pressed"; onrelease [ echo "key released" ] ]

scriptalias.name: add2bind
scriptalias.description: Adds a block of code, if it does not already exist, to a keybind.

command.name: keybind
command.description: Returns the contents of a keybind, bound with 'bind'.

command.name: keyeditbind
command.description: Returns the contents of a keybind, bound with 'editbind'.

command.name: keyspecbind
command.description: Returns the contents of a keybind, bound with 'specbind'.

command.name: searchbinds
command.description: Searches keybinds (bound with 'bind'), returns keys with matching contents.

remarks.remark: This is the inverse of 'keybind'

command.name: searcheditbinds
command.description: Searches keybinds (bound with 'editbind'), returns keys with matching contents.

remarks.remark: This is the inverse of 'keyeditbind'

command.name: searchspecbinds
command.description: Searches keybinds (bound with 'specbind'), returns keys with matching contents.

remarks.remark: This is the inverse of 'keyspecbind'

command.name: findkey
command.description: Returns the name of a key via a specified code.

remarks.remark: Returns -255 if the key does not exist.
See /config/keymap.cfg for a full list of valid key codes.

command.name: findkeycode
command.description: Returns the integer code of a key.

remarks.remark: Returns -255 if the key does not exist.
See /config/keymap.cfg for a full list of valid key names.

variable.name: resetbinds
variable.description: Resets all binds back to their default values.

remarks.remark: This command executes the file /config/resetbinds.cfg which will bind all keys to the values specified in that file, thus resetting the binds to their default values.

command.name: _resetallbinds
command.description: Clears all binds for all keys and all modes, including self-assigned ones.

remarks.remark: Do not use the command manually.

variable.name: _defaultbinds
variable.description: Whether or not the next call to _resetallbinds will remove any and all binds; cleaning up before setting the default bindings.

remarks.remark: Internal used in config/resetbinds.cfg

command.name: keymap
command.description: Sets up the keymap for the specified key.

remarks.remark: You should never have to use this command manually, use "bind" instead.

scriptalias.name: KEYPRESS
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed every time you press a key.

scriptalias.name: KEYRELEASE
scriptalias.description: If defined, this will be executed every time you release a key.

variable.name: sensitivity
variable.description: Sets the mouse sensitivity.

variable.name: sensitivityscale
variable.description: Scales all mouse sensitivity values.

remarks.remark: Changes all sensitivity values. If unsure, keep this at "1".

variable.name: scopesens
variable.description: Mouse sensitivity while scoped.

remarks.remark: If zero, autoscopesens determines, how sensitivity is changed during scoping.

variable.name: autoscopesens
variable.description: Switches between scopesensscale and autoscopesensscale.

remarks.remark: Determines how to calculate scoped sensitivity if scopesens is zero. If enabled, derives scoped sensitivity from scopefov and fov.

variable.name: scopesensscale
variable.description: Change sensitivity when scoping.

remarks.remark: If used, scoped sens = sensitivity * scopesensscale (roughly). Ignored, if autoscopesens is set.

value.description: factor to change sensitivity while scoped

variable.name: invmouse
variable.description: Sets mouse to "flight sim" mode.

remarks.remark: Inverts movement on the y-axis.

variable.name: relativemouse
variable.description: The way the mouse movement is handled.

remarks.remark: On Windows this is forced to 1 due to erratic behaviour of SDL_WarpMouseInWindow.
If set to 0 the mouse will be warped to center of the screen if appropriate.

variable.name: sdl_xgrab_bug
variable.description: Enable a workaround for buggy SDL X11 pointer grabbing.

remarks.remark: On Windows this is variable is not available. X11 is a *nix windowing system.
If set to 1 and relativemouse is on too, the workaround using XGrabPointer will be used.

variable.name: mfilter
variable.description: Sets the degree of mouse filtering (0.0 being no filtering).

variable.name: mouseaccel
variable.description: Sets the mouse acceleration.

command.name: togglegrab
command.description: Toggles grabbing of mouse and keyboard input in a game.

remarks.remark: Grabbing means that the mouse is confined to the AC, and nearly all keyboard input is passed directly to AC, and not interpreted by a window manager, if any. This is only useful when you run AC windowed.

variable.name: modkeypressed
variable.description: Indicates if a CTRL key is pressed.

command.name: modkeypressed
command.description: Is the CTRL currently key pressed?

remarks.remark: Can be used to change the behaviour of keybinds, like the F12 keybind in spectator mode uses it.

command.name: getentattr
command.description: Returns the value of the selected attribute of the nearest entity.

remarks.remark: It returns float values for some attributes. If "unscaled" flag is "1", raw integer values (representing the highest resolution) are returned.

command.name: getenttype
command.description: Returns the entity type of the nearest entity.

command.name: edittagclip
command.description: Sets tag clip type of all selected cubes.

remarks.remark: Type can be numeric or a keyword.

command.name: transformclipentities
command.description: Transforms all full height clip entities to tag clips.

command.name: applymapsoundchanges
command.description: During map editing, drop all mapsounds so they can be re-added.

command.name: edittoggle
command.description: Switches between map edit mode and normal.

remarks.remark: In map edit mode you can select bits of the map by clicking or dragging your crosshair on the floor or ceiling (using the "attack" identifier, normally MOUSE1), then use the identifiers below to modify the selection. While in edit mode, normal physics and collision don't apply (clips), and key repeat is ON. Note that if you fly outside the map, cube still renders the world as if you were standing on the floor directly below the camera.

command.name: edittex
command.description: Changes the texture on current selection by browsing through a list of textures directly shown on the cubes.

remarks.remark: Default keys are the six keys above the cursor keys, which each 2 of them cycle one type (and numpad 7/4 for upper-wall).

The way this works is slightly strange at first, but allows for very fast texture assignment. All textures are in 3 individual lists for each type (both wall kinds treated the same), and each time a texture is used, it is moved to the top of the list. So after a bit of editing, all your most frequently used textures will come first when pressing these keys, and the most recently used texture is set immediately when you press the forward key for the type. These lists are saved with the map. Make a selection (including wall bits) and press these keys to get a feel for what they do.

argument.description: the direction you want to cycle the textures in

variable.name: hudtexttl
variable.description: Show preview of textures during editing.

remarks.remark: When textures of the map geometry are changed, five textures around the current pick from the "last used" stack are shown.
The texture assigned to the "sky" slot is not shown. Instead, a plain blue rectangle is used.

command.name: settex
command.description: Sets a texture for the current selection.

argument.description: position of the texture to set in map cfg

command.name: editheight
command.description: Changes the height of the current selection.

argument.description: the delta value to move it in

key.description: moves downwards the selection in the floor
moves upwards the selection in the floor
moves downwards the selection in the ceiling
moves upwards the selection in the ceiling

command.name: solid
command.description: Makes the current selection all solid (i.e. wall) or all non-solid.

remarks.remark: This operation retains floor/ceiling heights/textures while swapping between the two.

command.name: equalize
command.description: Levels the floor/ceiling of the selection.

key.description: equalizes the selection on the floor
equalizes the selection on the ceiling

command.name: heightfield
command.description: Marks the current selection as a heightfield.

remarks.remark: It marks the current selection as a heightfield, with T being floor or ceiling, as above. A surface marked as heightfield will use the vdelta values (see below) of its 4 corners to create a sloped surface. To mark a heightfield as normal again (ignoring vdelta values, set or not) use "solid 0".

Heightfields should be made the exact size that is needed, not more not less. The most important reason for this is that cube automatically generates "caps" (side-faces for heightfields) only on the borders of the heightfield. This also means if you have 2 independent heightfields accidentally touch each other, you will not get correct caps. Also, a heightfield is slightly slower to render than a non-heightfield floor or ceiling. Last but not least, a heightfield should have all the same baseheight (i.e. the height determined by a normal editheight operation) to get correct results.

key.description: makes the selection on the floor a heightfield
makes the selection on the ceiling a heightfield

command.name: vdelta
command.description: Changes the vdelta value of the current selection.

remarks.remark: Note that unlike all other editing functions, this function doesn't affect a cube, but its top-left vertex (market by the dot in the editing cursor). So to edit a N * M heightfield, you will likely have to edit the vdelta of (N+1) * (M+1) cubes, i.e. you have to select 1 row and 1 column more in the opposite direction of the red dot to affect all the vertices of a heightfield of a given size (try it, it makes sense :).

A floor delta offsets vertices to beneath the level set by editheight (and a ceil delta to above). Delta offsets have a precision of a quarter of a unit, however you should use non-unitsize vertices only to touch other such vertices.
This only works if the cube is a heightfield.

key.description: manipulates downwards the corner of the current selection
manipulates upwards the corner of the current selection

command.name: corner
command.description: Makes the current selection into a "corner".

remarks.remark: Currently there is only one type of corner (a 45 degree one), only works on a single unit (cube) at a time. It can be positioned either next to 2 solid walls or in the middle of 2 higher floorlevels and 2 lower ones forming a diagonal (and similar with ceiling).

In both cases, the corner will orient itself automatically depending on its neighbours, behaviour with other configurations than the 2 above is unspecified. Since the latter configuration generates possibly 2 floor and 2 ceiling levels, up to 4 textures are used: for example for the 2 floors the higher one will of the cube itself, and the lower one of a neighbouring low cube. You can make bigger corners at once by issuing "corner" on grid aligned 2x2/4x4/8x8 selections, with equal size solid blocks next to them.

command.name: undo
command.description: Multi-level undo of any of the changes caused by editing operations.

remarks.remark: With editmeta pressed it also restores player position and selects the affected area.

command.name: redo
command.description: Redoes editing operations undone by 'undo'.

remarks.remark: With editmeta pressed it also restores player position and selects the affected area.

command.name: undolevel
command.description: Returns the number of undo steps that can be undone.

remarks.remark: If argument "level" is given, as many steps are undone, until "level" steps remain.
Unless memory limits delete states, undolevel commands can be undone with "redo".

example.explanation: - prints number of previous editing steps, for example "55". Do some editing and:
- undoes all changes to restore the previous state (if that state is still in memory)

variable.name: undomegs
variable.description: Sets the number of megabytes used for the undo buffer.

remarks.remark: Undo's work for any size areas, so the amount of undo steps per megabyte is more for small areas than for big ones (a megabyte fits 280 undo steps on a 16x16 area, but only 4 steps on a 128x128 area).

command.name: copy
command.description: Copies the current selection into a buffer.

command.name: copyent
command.description: Copies the current closest entity into a buffer.

remarks.remark: It also works with the menu list of copied entities. It works only while in edit mode.

command.name: paste
command.description: Pastes a previously copied selection.

remarks.remark: To paste a selection back requires a same size selection at the destination location. If it is not the same size the selection will be resized automatically prior to the paste operation (with the red dot as anchor), which is easier for large selections.

command.name: pasteent
command.description: Pastes a previously copied entity.

remarks.remark: It also works with the menu list of copied entities. It works only while in edit mode.
Pressing "editmeta" while using "pasteent" opens the menu with a list of copied entities.

scriptalias.name: countwalls
scriptalias.description: Returns the number of solid walls contained into the current selection.

argument.description: the integer of type of the walls you want to count

example.explanation: Output: The selection contains 3 solid wall(s)

command.name: replace
command.description: Repeats the last texture edit throughout the map.

remarks.remark: The way it works is intuitive: simply edit any texture anywhere, then using "replace" will replace all textures throughout the map in the same way (taking into account whether it was a floor/wall/ceil/upper too). If the there was more than one "old" texture in your selection, the one nearest to the red dot is used. This operation can't be undone.

command.name: newent
command.description: Adds a new entity.

remarks.remark: (x,y) is determined by the current selection (the red dot corner) and z by the camera height, of said type. The type of entity may optionally take attributes (depending on the entity).

argument.valueNotes: light (1), playerstart (2), pistol (3), ammobox (4), grenades (5), health (6), helmet (7), armour (8), akimbo (9), mapmodel (10), ladder (12), ctf-flag (13), sound (14), clip (15), plclip (16)

command.name: newent light
command.description: Adds a new light entity.

remarks.remark: if only argument R is specified, it is interpreted as brightness for white light.

argument.description: red colour component, see remarks below

command.name: newent playerstart
command.description: Adds a new spawn spot.

remarks.remark: The yaw is taken from the current camera yaw.

command.name: newent ammobox
command.description: Adds a new ammo box item.

command.name: newent pistol
command.description: Adds a pistol magazine item.

command.name: newent grenades
command.description: Adds a new grenades item.

command.name: newent health
command.description: Adds a new health item.

command.name: newent armour
command.description: Adds a new armour item.

command.name: newent helmet
command.description: Adds a new helmet item.

command.name: newent akimbo
command.description: Adds a new akimbo item.

command.name: newent mapmodel
command.description: Adds a map model to the map (i.e. a rendered md2/md3 model which you collide against but has no behaviour or movement).

remarks.remark: The mapmodel identifier is the desired map model which is defined by the 'mapmodel' command. The order in which the mapmodel is placed in the map config file defines the mapmodel identifier. The map texture refers to a texture which is defined by the 'texture' command, if omitted the models default skin will be used. The 'mapmodel' and 'texture' commands are placed in the map config normally. Mapmodels are more expensive than normal map geometry, so do not use insane amounts of them to replace normal geometry.

command.name: newent ctf-flag
command.description: Adds a CTF flag entity.

remarks.remark: Note that outside of edit mode, this entity is only rendered as flag if the current game mode is CTF.

command.name: newent ladder
command.description: Adds a ladder entity.

remarks.remark: Note that this entity is used for physics only, to create a visual ladder you will need to add a mapmodel entity too.

command.name: newent sound
command.description: Adds a sound entity.

remarks.remark: Will play map-specific sound so long as the player is within the radius. However, only up to the maxuses allowed for N (specified in the mapsound command) will play, even if the player is within the radius of more N sounds than the max. By default (size 0), the sound is a point source. Its volume is maximal at the entity's location, and tapers off to 0 at the radius.
