If size is specified, the volume is maximal within the specified size, and only starts tapering once outside this distance. Radius is always defined as distance from the entity's location, so a size greater than or equal to the radius will just make a sound that is always max volume within the radius, and off outside.

A sound entity can be either ambient or non-ambient. Ambient sounds have no specific direction, they are 'just there'. Non-ambient sounds however appear to come from a specific direction (stereo panning). If S is set to 0, the sound is a single point and will therefore be non-ambient. However if S is greater than 0, the sound will be ambient as it covers a specified area instead of being a single point.

command.name: newent clip
command.description: Adds a clip entity.

remarks.remark: Defines a clipping box against which the player will collide.
Use this clip type to clip visible obstacles like fences or the gas tank. If you only want to prevent a player from entering an area, use plclip instead.

argument.description: X radius around the box center
Y radius around the box center

command.name: newent plclip
command.description: Adds a player clip entity.

remarks.remark: Defines a clipping box against which (only) the player will collide.
Use this clip type to define no-go areas for players without visible obstacles, for example to prevent players from walking on a wall.
Nades will not be affected by this clip type.

argument.description: X radius around the box center
Y radius around the box center

command.name: delent
command.description: Deletes the entity closest to the player.

command.name: entset
command.description: Edits the closest entity.

remarks.remark: Overwrites the closest entity with the specified attributes. Some attributes may be specified as floats.

argument.valueNotes: light (1), playerstart (2), pistol (3), ammobox (4), grenades (5), health (6), helmet (7), armour (8), akimbo (9), mapmodel (10), ladder (12), ctf-flag (13), sound (14), clip (15), plclip (16)

command.name: entproperty
command.description: Changes property (attributes) of the closest entity.

remarks.remark: For example 'entproperty 0 2' when executed near a lightsource would increase its radius by 2.

Keys 1..7, in combination with the scrollwheel, can be used to alter the new entity attributes (attr1 - attr7). Key "M", in combination with the scrollwheel, can be used to move the entity. Pressing editmeta speeds up the scrolling. Pressing editmeta2 enables unscaled editing of entity attributes.
Increment is a float for some attributes. If "unscaled" flag is "1", increment is applied as unscaled integer, which means, it will change float attributes at their highest resolution.
If 100 is added to the attribute index parameter, the sign of the increment value is changed.

command.name: clearents
command.description: Deletes all entities of said type.

variable.name: cleanedit
variable.description: Turns on/off clean edit mode.

remarks.remark: While editing in clean edit mode, objects/guides not normally visible remain invisible.
i.e. The grid guidelines, selection borders, entity sparkles, clips, playerstart arrows are hidden

command.name: togglecleanedit
command.description: Inverses the on/off state of cleanedit

command.name: recalc
command.description: Recomputes all there is to recompute about a map, currently only lighting.

command.name: savemap
command.description: Saves the current map.

remarks.remark: It makes a versioned backup (mapname_N.BAK) if a map by that name already exists. If the name argument is omitted, it is saved under the current map name.

Where you store a map depends on the complexity of what you are creating: if its a single map (maybe with its own .cfg) then the "base" package is the best place. If its multiple maps or a map with new media (textures etc.) its better to store it in its own package (a directory under "packages"), which makes distributing it less messy.

For "savemap" to save different maps during editing with undo data, the variable "preserveundosonsave" has to be "1". It is "0" by default. "savemap" when not editing saves optimised map, with no undo data.

argument.description: file name of the map, see command 'map' for the naming scheme

command.name: savemapoptimised
command.description: Saves optimised the current map, with no undo data.

remarks.remark: It makes a versioned backup (mapname_N.BAK) if a map by that name already exists. If the name argument is omitted, it is saved under the current map name.

argument.description: file name of the map, see command 'map' for the naming scheme

variable.name: preserveundosonsave
variable.description: Determines if undo data should be preserved on using "savemap" command.

remarks.remark: Undo data can be saved only in edit mode.

variable.name: mapbackupsonsave
variable.description: Determines if map backups (.bak) should be created when a map is saved.

command.name: savemap9
command.description: Saves a map in old map format 9 (may lose some map details that are not possible with format 9).

command.name: newmap
command.description: Creates a new map.

remarks.remark: The new map has 2^S cubes. For S, 6 is small, 7 medium, 8 large.

argument.description: the size of the new map

command.name: mapsize
command.description: Outputs the mapsize.

command.name: mapenlarge
command.description: Enlarges the current map.

remarks.remark: This command will make the current map 1 power of two bigger. So a size 6 map (64x64 units) will become a size 7 map (128x128), with the old map in the middle (from 32-96) and the new areas solid.

command.name: mapshrink
command.description: Reduces the world size by 1.

remarks.remark: This command will make the current map 1 power of two smaller. So a size 7 map (128x128) will become a 6 size map (64x64 units), by removing 32 cubes from each side. The area to be removed needs to be empty (= all solid).

variable.name: mapmsg
variable.description: Sets the map message, which will be displayed when the map loads.

remarks.remark: You will need to use quote marks around the message, otherwise it save the message correctly.
For example: /mapmsg "Map By Author"
You can get the current map message with the $mapmsg variable.

command.name: editmapmsg
command.description: Allows to edit the map message.

variable.name: mapinfo_license
variable.description: Sets the map license.

remarks.remark: The name of license is stored withing the header of a map file. The license string is meant to hold an abbreviated name of the license, picked from a list of known map licenses.
You can get the type of map license with the $mapinfo_license variable.

variable.name: mapinfo_comment
variable.description: Sets the map comment string.

remarks.remark: The variable is stored withing the header of a map file. The comment string is ignored, as long as no map license string is set.
You can get the comment string with the $mapinfo_comment variable.

command.name: entstats
command.description: Prints some map entity statistics to the console.

command.name: closestenttype
command.description: Restricts 'closest entity' display to one entity type.

remarks.remark: It returns the current value and not change the value if the argument is "-".

argument.valueNotes: light (1), playerstart (2), pistol (3), ammobox (4), grenades (5), health (6), helmet (7), armour (8), akimbo (9), mapmodel (10), ladder (12), ctf-flag (13), sound (14), clip (15), plclip (16)

command.name: nextclosestent
command.description: Chooses another 'closest ent'.

remarks.remark: Use this, when two entities are placed in exactly the same location.

command.name: nextplayerstart
command.description: Visit next player spawn entity.

command.name: gonextplayerstart
command.description: Visit next or previous player spawn entity.

command.name: convertclips
command.description: Converts the nearest entity (if its a clip or plclip) to its opposite type.

example.explanation: Assuming the nearest entity is a clip, it will be converted to a plclip.
Assuming the nearest entity is a plclip, it will be converted to a clip.

command.name: movemap
command.description: Moves the whole map (including all entities) in the specified direction.

command.name: selectionflip
command.description: Flips the selected part of the map at an axis.

command.name: selectionrotate
command.description: Rotates the selected part of the map in 90 degree steps.

remarks.remark: To rotate clockwise, use a positive number of steps. Note, that only quadratic selections can be rotated by 90 degrees.

variable.name: editaxis
variable.description: Returns a value for the main axis of player orientation.

remarks.remark: "100" is added if the player is looking in the negative direction of the axis.

variable.name: advancemaprevision
variable.description: Selects the increment of the map revision number for the next 'savemap'.

variable.name: showmodelclipping
variable.description: Show mapmodel clipping during edit mode.

variable.name: showgrid
variable.description: Show editing cursor grid.

variable.name: showclips
variable.description: Show clips/plclips/mapmodel clips in edit mode.

variable.name: showtagclips
variable.description: Show tagclips/tagplclips in edit mode.

variable.name: tagnum
variable.description: Number of particles in the focused on tagclip volume.

remarks.remark: source comments suggest this may become hardwired in the future

variable.name: tagnumfull
variable.description: Number of particles in any tagclip volume - if showtagclipfocus is not 1.

remarks.remark: source comments suggest this may become hardwired in the future

variable.name: taglife
variable.description: Fading time of sparklies in focused on tagclip volume

remarks.remark: source comments suggest this may become hardwired in the future

variable.name: showladderentities
variable.description: Show ladder entities (as blue wireframes) in edit mode.

command.name: guidetoggle
command.description: Enables or disables a special set of default textures while editing.

remarks.remark: The textures in "packages/textures/map_editor" are used.

variable.name: waterlevel
variable.description: Sets the global water level for the map.

remarks.remark: Every cube that has a lower floor than the water level will be rendered with a nice wavy water alpha texture. Water physics will be applied to any entity located below it.

Performance notes: water is rendered for a whole square encapsulating all visible water areas in the map (try flying above the map in edit mode to see how). So the most efficient water is a single body of water, or multiple water areas that are mostly not visible from each other. Players can influence how accurate the water is rendered using the "watersubdiv" command (map config).

command.name: getwatercolour
command.description: Returns a string with the four components of the water colour: red, green, blue and alpha.

command.name: setwatercolour
command.description: Allows setting the components of the water colour independently.

remarks.remark: "what" is either a keyword "red|green|blue|alpha" or the index number 0..3 and determines, which component is set to value.

variable.name: ambient
variable.description: Controls the ambient lighting of the map, i.e. how bright areas not affected by any light entities will appear.
This should be entered in hexadecimal notation, as 0xRRGGBB. If the green and blue are both zero, the input will be interpreted as a grayscale value.

variable.name: fullbright
variable.description: Sets all light values to fullbright.

remarks.remark: Will be reset when you issue a 'recalc'. Only works in edit mode.

variable.name: fullbrightlevel
variable.description: Sets the level of brightness to use when using the command "/fullbright 1".

command.name: showmip
command.description: Toggles between showing what parts of the scenery are rendered.

remarks.remark: Shows what parts of the scenery are rendered using what size cubes and outputs some statistics about it. This can give map editors hints as to what architecture to align, textures to change, etc.
If "showfocuscubedetails" is enabled, "showmip" stats on the HUD are hidden.

command.name: showfocuscubedetails
command.description: Shows detailed geometry data of the cube inside editing focus.

remarks.remark: It shows on the HUD cube type, floor and ceiling heights, vdelta and all textures.

command.name: toggleocull
command.description: Turns occlusion culling on and off.

remarks.remark: The reason one may want to turn it off is to get an overview of the map from above, without having all occluded bits stripped out.

command.name: slope
command.description: Makes a slope out of the current selection.

remarks.remark: The selection must be a heightfield before this command can be used. The steps specify the slope with the red vertex as left-top, i.e. "slope 1 2" will make a slope that increases just 1 step from left to right, and is slightly steeper from top to bottom. "slope -6 0" decreases steeply from left to right, and does not slope at all from top to bottom. Note that like the vdelta command, an increasing vdelta goes further away from the player, regardless of floor or ceiling.

command.name: arch
command.description: Makes an arch out of the current selection.

remarks.remark: The selection must be a heightfield before this command can be used. Will make the arch in the long direction, i.e when you have 6x2 cubes selected, the arch will span 7 vertices. Optionally, sidedelta specifies the delta to add to the outer rows of vertices in the other direction, i.e. give the impression of an arch that bends 2 ways (try "arch 2" on an selection of at least 2 thick to see the effect). Not all arch sizes are necessarily available, see config/prefabs.cfg.

command.name: archvertex
command.description: Defines a vertex delta for a specific arch span prefab, used by the 'arch' command.

remarks.remark: It returns the old value of the vertex, and if the vertex argument is omitted, doesn't change it.
See config/prefabs.cfg for an example on usage.

variable.name: enlargearchslopeselections
variable.description: Automatically enlarge selections after placing arches or slopes.

remarks.remark: If the variable is set to 1, after placing an arch or a slope, the selection is enlarged, so that the arch or slope can be changed by vdelta increments (for example, to raise an arch in 1/4 cube increments).
If the variable is set to 0 (which is default), the selection remains unchanged. This way, for example, the arch can be raised or lowered by regular cube increments.

command.name: perlin
command.description: Generates a perlin noise landscape in the current selection.

remarks.remark: Keep the seed the same to create multiple perlin areas which fit with each other, or use different numbers if to create alternative random generations.

argument.description: the scale, frequency of the features
cube size, how many cubes to generate a surface for at once (unused)

command.name: select
command.description: Resets all current selections and selects the given area, as if dragged with the mouse.

remarks.remark: This command is similar to addselection although "select" resets all selections.

argument.description: the length along the X axis
the length along the Y axis

command.name: addselection
command.description: Selects the given area, as if dragged with the mouse holding editmeta.

remarks.remark: This command is useful for making complex geometry-generating scripts. It adds a selection to the current list of selections. The dimensions of the current selections can be accessed by the commands selx, sely, selxs and selys. These commands return the list of coordinates corresponding to each selection.
Coordinates are as follows: after a "newmap 6" the top-left corner (the one where the red dot points) are (8,8), the opposite corner is (56,56) (or (120,120) on a "newmap 7" etc.).

argument.description: the length along the X axis
the length along the Y axis

command.name: selectall
command.description: Selects the whole map (minus the two cubes wide border).

command.name: resetselections
command.description: Resets all current selections.

command.name: expandselection
command.description: Increases the size of the current selection by N cubes on all sides.

remarks.remark: Instead of manually executing this command, you can bind "domodifier 11" to a key. While holding this key you can expand/shrink the current selection with the mouse wheel.
It works also with multiple selections.

command.name: shrinkselection
command.description: Decreases the size of the current selection by N cubes on all sides.

remarks.remark: Instead of manually executing this command, you can bind "domodifier 11" to a key. While holding this key you can expand/shrink the current selection with the mouse wheel.
It works also with multiple selections.

command.name: enlargevdeltaselections
command.description: Enlarges all selections by one cube in x- and y- direction, to change a selection from the "cube area" to the "vdelta area".

remarks.remark: If an argument is given, it is used as increment value, so, for example "enlargevdeltaselections -1" undoes a previous enlargement.

command.name: selx
command.description: Returns the x-coordinate of the westernmost (towards negative x) cube(s) in the current selection.

command.name: selxs
command.description: Returns the x-span (size on the x-axis) of the current selection.

command.name: sely
command.description: Returns the y-coordinate of the northernmost (towards negative y) cube(s) in the current selection.

command.name: selys
command.description: Returns the y-span (size on the y-axis) of the current selection.

command.name: selectionwalk
command.description: Iterates over all cubes in all selections and executes "action" for each cube.

remarks.remark: The cubes of every selection are framed by executions of "beginsel" and "endsel", i.e. for each new selection, before executing "action" for the cubes of that selection, "beginsel" is executed, and then, after actions for all cubes of that selection, "endsel" is executed. The action script is allowed to make changes to cube attributes, and if it does, an undo point is automatically added. "beginsel" and "endsel" are optional.
While the scripts are executed, several aliases provide further info:
"sw_cursel" - position and size of the current selection. Valid in all three scripts. Holds four integer values for x, y, xs, ys. See "select" command for details.
(all following aliases are only valid during the execution of the action script and provide the attributes of one cube of the map)
"sw_abs_x", "sw_abs_y", "sw_rel_x", "sw_rel_y" - absolute and relative (within the current selection) coordinates of the current cube. Read-only values.
"sw_type" - type of the current cube. Can be 0..4 for SOLID, CORNER, FHF, CHF and SPACE. May be changed to other numerical value or keyword.
"sw_floor", "sw_ceil" - floor and ceiling heights of the current cube. Range -128..127.
"sw_wtex", "sw_ftex", "sw_ctex", "sw_utex" - texture slot indices for wall, floor, ceiling and upper wall of the current cube.
"sw_vdelta", "sw_tag" - vdelta and tag values of current cube.
"sw_r", "sw_g", "sw_b" - current light values of current cube. Can be edited, but only with temporary effect. Will be reset with the next light recalc.

The command is mostly useful for statistics scripts (like counting cubes with certain attributes), but is can also be used for scripted editing, as the following (useless) example shows: selectionwalk [ += sw_floor (rnd 2) ]

argument.description: begin action before cubes action of each selection
end action before cubes action of each selection

scriptalias.name: pushselections
scriptalias.description: Stores the positions of all current selections.

remarks.remark: Can be used repeatedly. To restore the selections, type "popselections".

command.name: scalelights
command.description: Scales all lights in the map.

remarks.remark: This command is useful if a map is too dark or bright but you want to keep the light entities where they are.

variable.name: editing
variable.description: A variable indicating if the game is in editmode.

variable.name: editing_sp
variable.description: A variable indicating if the game is in singleplayer editmode.

variable.name: flrceil
variable.description: A variable indicating if the player looks at the floor or at the ceiling.

scriptalias.name: onNewMap
scriptalias.description: This alias will automatically be executed when a new map is created via the "newmap" command.

remarks.remark: Does not affect the loading of an existing map.

variable.name: oldselstyle
variable.description: Enables or disables using squares to render the editing grid/current selection instead of triangles.

command.name: gotoposition
command.description: Only in edit mode: gets and sets camera position.

remarks.remark: Returns x, y, z, yaw and pitch. Sets x, y, z, yaw and pitch, if the parameter is not an empty string.

example.explanation: Change yaw and pitch to look straight in +y direction.

command.name: setvantagepoint
command.description: Sets vantage point in current camera position.

remarks.remark: The vantage point is supposed to be a distinctive view on a map - like the angle from which the preview picture was taken. It is allowed to use when editing offline or spectating offline.
A map can only have one vantage point.

command.name: getvantagepoint
command.description: Returns string with coordinates of vantage point or empty string, if none is set.

command.name: gotovantagepoint
command.description: Sets camera position in vantage point.

remarks.remark: It returns 1, if the map actually has a vantage point set.

command.name: clearvantagepoint
command.description: Clears a set parameters of vantage point.

command.name: showmapstats
command.description: Prints some map statistics.

command.name: showmapdims
command.description: Prints map dimensions.

variable.name: unsavededits
variable.description: Holds the number of unsaved edits.

command.name: mapmodelslotname
command.description: Returns the map model name (and path) of the mapmodel registered in the given slot number in the map config file.

command.name: mapmodelslotbyname
command.description: Returns the slot number registered in the map config file of the model with the given name.

command.name: mapmodelslotusage
command.description: Returns a list of map entity indices which use a certain mapmodel slot.

remarks.remark: If the mapmodel is unused, it returns an empty string.
It returns a single space, if the model slot is not used by any map entity, but is required by another model (with entities).

command.name: editmapmodelslot
command.description: Edits the parameters of a mapmodel slot.

remarks.remark: Edits the parameters of a mapmodel slot. Only non-empty parameters actually change something.

The command returns the resulting data of the mapmodel slot. If only the mapmodel slot number is specified, no changes are made, but the current data is returned (also in non-edit mode). Therefore the command can be used to get and set parameters.
If anything is changed, automapconfig is enabled.

argument.description: redundant, leave it at zero so you don't break the command

example.explanation: sets the z-offset of slot #33 to -5 without affecting other parameters
prints the current parameters of mapmodel slot #33 , for example: 0 0 0 0 "makke/lightbulb"

command.name: deletemapmodelslot
command.description: Deletes an unused mapmodel slot.

remarks.remark: If "purge" is specified as second argument, it also deletes an used slot (including all map entities which use that mapmodel).
Also it enables automapconfig.

command.name: sortmapmodelslots
command.description: Sorts all mapmoodel slots alphabetically and merges identical slots.

remarks.remark: By default, the list is sorted and only unused identical (with the same model and parameters) slots are merged. The keywords can be combined in any order. "nomerge" takes priority over "mergeused".

example.explanation: - sorts the mapmodel slot list alphabetically and merge unused identical slots. Merging an unused slot is pretty much the same as deleting it, so this command sorts the list and removes unneeded double entries
- merges (deletes) unused double entries in the mapmodel slot list

- merges double entries in the mapmodel slot list. If two identical entries are used in the map, all uses are mapped to the new combined slot. This leaves no visual changes on the map. Should be avoided, if mapmodel slots have been renamed manually - and the renaming isn't finished yet
- sorts the mapmodel slot list and merges all double entries

argument.description: do not sort the list alphabetically
merge used and unused (identical) slots freely

variable.name: mapmodelchanged
variable.description: Set to "1" with every command that changes mapmodel slots.

remarks.remark: Should be used to trigger a rebuild of mapmodel menus.

command.name: mapmodelregister
command.description: Adds values for all attributes to a specific mapmodel.

remarks.remark: This is used to restore the cached values from config/mapmodelattributes.cfg during game start. It does not actually verify of load the model.

command.name: mapmodelregistryclear
command.description: Deletes all loaded mapmodel attributes.

command.name: getmapmodelattributes
command.description: Returns values for all attributes to a specific mapmodel.

remarks.remark: If modelpath is a number, it is interpreted as index for the list of models in the current map config. If no attribute name is specified, all attributes are printed to the console instead.

argument.valueNotes: keywords, desc, defaults, usage, author, license, distribution, version

command.name: listallmapmodelattributes
command.description: Returns a table of all known mapmodels.

remarks.remark: Each model is listed with the modelpath and the values for the requested attributes. To be used instead of a fixed table in menu_edit.cfg.

In addition to attribute names, the function also allows the keywords "explodekeywords" and "sortby:" as arguments. If "explodekeywords" is given, all mapmodels with more than one keyword are listed multiple times, once for each keyword. If an attribute name is preceeded by "sortby:" the list will be sorted by this table column. If "sortby:" is used several times, this first sort will have highest priority. The list is always sorted by path by default.

argument.valueNotes: explodekeywords, sortby: keywords, desc, defaults, usage, author, license, distribution, version

example.code: listallmapmodelattributes sortby: author sortby: desc explodekeywords

command.name: loadallmapmodels
command.description: Tries to load mapmodels from all paths below packages/models/mapmodels.

remarks.remark: It will throw a lot of error messages, because not all directories contain models to load. This command can be used to build or rebuild the complete list of all available mapmodels. It is only necessary, if models are added manually to the directories, since every mapmodel gets added to the list when it is loaded - which takes care of all automatically downloaded models.

scriptalias.name: mapmodelzoff
scriptalias.description: Allows negative z-offsets for mapmodels.

remarks.remark: A mapmodel entity is placed at a z-coordinate that is based on the floor height of map geometry and a z-offset. The z-offset is a sum of the entity attribute 3 and the third mapmodel slot parameter. The entity z-offset can range from 0 to 255 while the mapmodel slot parameter can be any integer including negative numbers. So, to place a mapmodel below floor height, the mapmodel slot parameter has to be negative.

"mapmodelzoff" script decreases the mapmodel slot parameter by one and increases the z-offset of every mapmodel which uses that slot also by one. This means, that all mapmodel are exact in the same place afterwards - but the entity z-offset now has room to lower the mapmodel by one more cube.
If you need more z-offset available, run the script several times.

command.name: gettexturelist
command.description: Returns a table of all texture files fitting a certain description.

remarks.remark: All files found under packages/textures are examined.

By default, the command returns a list with two columns: path and filename. If "excludes" is exactly one path prefix to exclude, the table gets a third column with path names without that prefix. If "extensions" is exactly one extension which does not start with the character '.', the table gets an additional (third or fourth) column containing file names without that extension.

argument.description: Optional list of path prefixes to include in the table.
Optional list of path prefixes to exclude from the table.
Optional list of filename extensions to include in the table.

example.explanation: Outputs two columns like "noctua/wall" "wall02.jpg", but omits skymaps and special textures for the editor
Outputs only textures by makke and adds a third column like "makke/rattrap" "rb_box_03.jpg" "/rattrap"

command.name: gettextureorigin
command.description: Returns the location where the texture file actually can be found.

remarks.remark: The possibilities are:
"official": texture file was found in the working directory, which indicates an official texture.
"custom": texture file was found in the profile directory, which means, the texture is either manually installed or downloaded.
"package dir #x": texture file was found in a mod directory.
"<file not found>"

argument.description: filename or partial path with filename

command.name: textureslotbyname
command.description: Returns the list of numbers of all texture slots which use that texture file.

command.name: textureslotusage
command.description: Returns a list of mapmodels who use that texture as skin.

remarks.remark: If no mapmodel uses the texture, but world geometry does, a string of whitespace is returned. If the mapmodel is unused, an empty string is returned.

command.name: textureslotusagelist
command.description: Returns a list of 256 numbers representing the number of uses for every texture slot.

remarks.remark: If "what" is "onlygeometry", the uses as map model skin do not count.
If "what" is "onlymodels", the uses in map geometry do not count.
It returns two values per slot: usage and visibility.
If "what" is "onlymostvisible", instead of the regular list, a list of only the most used wall, floor, ceiling and upper wall textures (alternating with the keywords) is returned.

command.name: deletetextureslot
command.description: Deletes an unused texture slot.

remarks.remark: If "purge" word is put as second argument, it also deletes an used slot. All mapmodels that use that texture as skin are changed to default skin. All world geometry, which uses the texture, is instead set to use slot #255 or a specified replacement slot. Slots below #5 always require "purge", no matter if they are in use (default slots).
Also enables automapconfig.

command.name: edittextureslot
command.description: Edits the parameters of a texture slot.

remarks.remark: Only non-empty parameters actually change something. The command returns the resulting data of the texture slot. If only the texture slot number is specified, no changes are made, but the current data is returned (also in non-edit mode). Therefore the command can be used to get and set parameters.
If anything is changed, automapconfig is enabled.

example.explanation: Prints the current parameters of texture slot #33, for example: 0 "zastrow/3wood_crate_10.jpg"

command.name: edittexturestack
command.description: Puts a texture slot in a "last used" list up front.

remarks.remark: The first parameter picks the list, the second parameter is the texture slot number to be used for the next edit.

command.name: sorttextureslots
command.description: Sorts all texture slots alphabetically and merges identical slots.

remarks.remark: By default, the list is sorted (except the first five) and only unused identical (with the same texture and scale factor) slots are merged. The keywords can be combined in any order. "nomerge" takes priority over "mergeused".

It allows to manually sort also the first few slots by adding the slot number to move to the slots #1, #2, #3, #4 (for example "sorttextureslots 11 12 13 14" will move slot #11 to slot #1, #12 to #2, #13 to #3 and #14 to #4, and sort the rest texture slots).
See examples in the "sortmapmodelslots" reference.

argument.description: do not sort the list alphabetically
merge used and unused (identical) slots freely

command.name: getmapsoundlist
command.description: Returns a list of all *.wav and *.ogg files below packages/audio/ambience.

command.name: getmapsoundorigin
command.description: Returns the location where the map sound file actually can be found.

remarks.remark: The possibilities are:
"official": mapsound file was found in the working directory, which indicates an official mapsound.
"custom": mapsound file was found in the profile directory, which means, the mapsound is either manually installed or downloaded.
"package dir #x": mapsound file was found in a mod directory.
"<file not found>"

argument.description: filename or partial path with filename

command.name: mapsoundslotbyname
command.description: Returns the list of numbers of all mapsound slots which use that sound file.

command.name: mapsoundslotusage
command.description: Returns a list of map entity indices which use a certain map sound slot.

remarks.remark: If the sound is unused, it returns an empty string.

command.name: editmapsoundslot
command.description: Edits path/name and maxuses parameters of a mapsound slot.

remarks.remark: Only non-empty parameters actually change something. The command returns the resulting data of the map sound slot. If only the map sound slot number is specified, no changes are made, but the current data is returned (also in non-edit mode). Therefore the command can be used to get and set parameters.
If anything is changed, automapconfig is enabled.

command.name: deletemapsoundslot
command.description: Deletes an unused map sound slot.

remarks.remark: If "purge" is specified as second argument, it also deletes an used slot (including all map entities which use that sound).
Also it enables automapconfig.

command.name: sortmapsoundslots
command.description: Sorts all mapsound slots alphabetically and merges identical slots.

remarks.remark: By default, the list is sorted and only unused identical slots are merged. The keywords can be combined in any order. "nomerge" takes priority over "mergeused".
See examples in the "sortmapmodelslots" reference.

argument.description: do not sort the list alphabetically
merge used and unused (identical) slots freely

variable.name: mapsoundchanged
variable.description: Set to "1" with every command that changes mapsound slots.

remarks.remark: Should be used to trigger a rebuild of mapsound menus.

command.name: automapconfig
command.description: Enables the "automatic embedded map config data" feature.

remarks.remark: With the next map save the map config file will get renamed and the map config data stored inside the map file.

command.name: getautomapconfig
command.description: Returns "1" if automapconfig is already enabled, "0" otherwise.

command.name: embedconfigfile
command.description: Loads the map config file, includes it in the map header and renames the original config file.

remarks.remark: Embedded config files take precedence over regular config files.

command.name: extractconfigfile
command.description: Writes an embedded config file to a separate file and removes it from the map header.

command.name: listheaderextras
command.description: Returns a list with additional data ("header extras") from current map header.

remarks.remark: The header extras can be permanent, like the embedded config file, or can be used only once after map load, like the undo/redo data. Additional extra data can be easily added and will not break backward compatibility.

command.name: addentity
command.description: Adds an entity of the specified type at the current camera position.

remarks.remark: It also returns the index number of the new entity, so that the other attributes can be set by editentity.

argument.valueNotes: light (1), playerstart (2), pistol (3), ammobox (4), grenades (5), health (6), helmet (7), armour (8), akimbo (9), mapmodel (10), ladder (12), ctf-flag (13), sound (14), clip (15), plclip (16)

command.name: editentity
command.description: Edits a map entity.

remarks.remark: It edits only parameters given a non-empty value. Returns the type and the values of all attributes (x, y, z, attr1 - attr7). It uses float values for some attributes, return values also may be float.

example.explanation: Prints all attributes of map entity number 33, for example "light 174 172 12 20 255 200 200 0 0 0"
Changes the y-position of entity 33 to 173

command.name: deleteentity
command.description: Deletes a map entity.

remarks.remark: Note: deleting an entity only marks it as unused. It will be completely removed after saving and loading the map.

command.name: enumentities
command.description: Returns a list of the numbers of all entities of that type.

remarks.remark: If no such entities exist or the entity type could not be recognised, the list is empty.

argument.valueNotes: light, sound, clip, plclip, playerstart, pistol, ammobox, grenades, health, armour, akimbo, mapmodel, ladder, ctf-flag, helmet

command.name: gotoentity
command.description: Jump to the location of a map entity.

remarks.remark: You can get the entity number with use "enumentities" command.

command.name: getclosestent
command.description: Returns the entity index number of the closest entity (or of the pinned entity, if one exists).

remarks.remark: Returns -1, if no entities are on the map.
Returns always exactly the entity, that edit commands like delent will use next.

command.name: toggleclosestentpin
command.description: Toggles the pin on the "closest entity" selector.

remarks.remark: The HUD will indicate the lock by showing "pinned" instead of "closest" entity. All actions, that would otherwise affect the closest entity, will affect the pinned entity instead. Deleting the locked entity will unlock it.

variable.name: pointatent
variable.description: Enables or disables pointing at entity sparklies.

remarks.remark: If an entity is pointed at during disabling, it is pinned.

variable.name: pointatentmaxangle
variable.description: Specifies the required precision for pointing at entities sparklies.

variable.name: edithideentmask
variable.description: Integer variable containing a bitmask of hidden entity types.

command.name: getdeletedentities
command.description: Returns a list of deleted entities.

remarks.remark: Each line contains the entity type, the position and all seven attributes.

command.name: undelent
command.description: Restores deleted entity.

remarks.remark: If no index is specified, the last deleted entity is restored. If an index is given, the specified entity from the list of deleted entities is restored.
BACKSPACE in combination with editmeta undeletes the last deleted entity.
BACKSPACE in combination with editmeta2 brings up the menu "deleted entities".

command.name: unlistdeletedentity
command.description: Removes entities from the list of deleted entities.

remarks.remark: If <which> is a number, the specified entry from the list of deleted entities gets removed.
If <which> is "all", the whole list of deleted entities gets deleted.
If <which> is "last" the last deleted entity is removed from the list of deleted entities.
Returns the number of entities on the list of deleted entities (even if the parameter <which> was unknown or not specified).

command.name: xmap_list
command.description: Lists all xmaps currently in memory.

command.name: xmap_store
command.description: Creates a snapshot and stores it under the given nickname.

remarks.remark: Nicknames have to qualify as valid filenames.

command.name: xmap_restore
command.description: Restores the xmap snapshot.

remarks.remark: 1. If nickname is not given, it restores the last automatic backup snapshot. Automatic snapshots are taken:
a) before a snapshot is restored,
b) before a new map is loaded (if there were unsaved edits on the map) and
c) when the game ends (if there were unsaved edits).
2. If nickname is given, the command restores the named snapshot, it also creates a backup snapshot of the current editing data.

command.name: xmap_delete
command.description: Deletes the named snapshot.

command.name: xmap_delete_backup
command.description: Deletes the backup xmap.

command.name: xmap_keep_backup
command.description: Moves the backup xmap to a regular named spot.

command.name: xmap_rename
command.description: Changes the nickname of the xmap.

command.name: getxmaplist
command.description: Returns a list of all regular xmaps in memory, or, if 'what' is "bak", the details of a stored backup xmap.

remarks.remark: Each xmap is listed with nickname and description.

command.name: addtodoentity
command.description: Adds the entity #index to the TODO list.

remarks.remark: Entity errors during map load are automatically added to the list. The list is saved and restored with xmaps.

command.name: cleartodoentities
command.description: Clears list of TODO entities.

remarks.remark: The list is also deleted, when a new map is loaded.
If an entity number is given as an argument, only entries for this entity are cleared.

command.name: enumtodoentities
command.description: Returns a list of TODO entities.

remarks.remark: Returns entity index number and comment for every entry.

variable.name: showplayerstarts
variable.description: Show all playerstarts in edit mode.

remarks.remark: Set showplayerstarts to "1" to see a playermodel rendered at all playerstart entities.

command.name: mapmrproper
command.description: Cleanups hidden map attributes.

remarks.remark: "mapmrproper" tries to optimize hidden attributes of maps in a way, that the map can be handled in bigger chunks by the renderer.

The mipmapping routine does not take into account, if certain textures of a cube are visible at all, when it collects otherwise identical cubes to be handled en-bloc. "mapmrproper" changes invisible textures in a way, that the cubes are in fact identical - so, that the mipmapper is satisfied. The optimizer does not change any map properties that are visible in any way.
Before any changes are made, mapmrproper creates a backup, which can be restored by "undo" command. Enable mipstats ("showmip" command), to see, what has been done.

command.name: calcmipstats
command.description: Counts all the mips in the current map and prints their numbers as 1x1/2x2/4x4/8x8/16x16/32x32/64x64.

command.name: editmeta
command.description: First modifier key for editing mode.

remarks.remark: Go to references mentioned below to see the use.

command.name: editmeta2
command.description: Second modifier key for editing mode.

remarks.remark: Go to references mentioned below to see the use.

variable.name: editmetakeydown
variable.description: Indicates if editmeta key is pressed.

value.description: state of the first editmeta key

variable.name: editmeta2down
variable.description: Indicates if second editmeta key is pressed.

value.description: state of the second editmeta key

variable.name: rereadtexturelists
variable.description: Variable, which is set to "1" when a texture is downloaded.

remarks.remark: Used to trigger menu rebuilds.

variable.name: rereadsoundlists
variable.description: Variable, which is set to "1" when a sound is downloaded.

remarks.remark: Used to trigger menu rebuilds.

command.name: mapareacheck
command.description: Calculates some key values to determine map geometry viability.

remarks.remark: It returns different sets of statistics, depending on the keyword "what":
"vdelta" - returns table of numbers of cubes within a certain range of vdelta differences (steepness). First entry is "0..2 cubes steep", next is "2..4" and so on.
"steepest" - returns the coordinates of the steepest heightfield cube.
"total" - returns the number of non-solid cubes on the map.
"pprest" - returns the number of cubes _not_ visible from one of the probe positions.

"pp" (default) - returns a table of all (currently 64) probe points of the map. Each probe point is listed with: x-coordinate, y-coordinate, floor height, area visible, volume of visible area, average height in visible area.

command.name: getmaptimestamp
command.description: Returns the "last written" timestamp of the current map in the requested format.

remarks.remark: If "fmt" starts with "U", the time is given as UTC, otherwise as local time. If "fmt" is empty, or not given or just the "U", the format defaults to "YYYYMMDD_hh.mm.ss". Use "%c" to get something nicer.
The same format options as in strftime().

variable.name: _ignoreillegalpaths
variable.description: Whether or not texture paths are scrutinized.

remarks.remark: If during mapload textureslots can't be filled and this is not set to 1 a "missing media" error is raised.
It is used in the optional cubescript config/opt/convmap.cfg

command.name: stairs
command.description: Places stairs in all selections.

remarks.remark: "xs" and "ys" determine the step width in x- and y-direction.

scriptalias.name: updateeditinfopanel
scriptalias.description: A cubescript hook to provide additional information about the current edit situation.

remarks.remark: For example it provides additional information about the closest entity.
The returned text is rendered on the right side of the screen.
Default for "updateeditinfopanel" is "explainclosestentity" script which provides detailed info about the closest entity.

variable.name: editinfopanelmillis
variable.description: Update the edit info panel every N milliseconds.

variable.name: hideeditinfopanel
variable.description: Hide the edit info panel.

variable.name: hideeditslotinfo
variable.description: Hide the closest entity filename info.

value.description: 0: show info always, 1: only show "unassigned slot" if necessary, 2: never show info

command.name: mapartist
command.description: Adds artist info to a map.

argument.description: Prints the map artist player ID
Sets the map artist player ID to the player currently logged in
Returns the current map artist player ID
Erases an existing map artist record in the current map

command.name: modeinfo
command.description: Adds modeinfo info to a map.

remarks.remark: See possibilities of mode list and flags (keywords) in config/maprot.cfg file. To use flags for all modes you can use "all" value instead of mode list.

argument.description: Returns list of current modeinfo entries
Erases current list of modeinfo entries
Specifies flags for a list of modes

command.name: showtagclipfocus
command.description: Show the volume of a focused clip entity as a cloud of sparklies.

key.name: B
key.description: while pressed clips are clouds of sparklies

remarks.remark: To see the volume rather than the boundaries of a clip entity you can hold the B key in editing mode while pointing at it.

command.name: updatemapmodeldependencies
command.description: Update map config with any mapmodels required by those in use.

variable.name: editingsettingsvisibletime
variable.description: How long the temporary bits of showeditingsettings are displayed.

remarks.remark: Slide in/out the boxes and/or text of the showeditingsettings display.

variable.name: showeditingsettings
variable.description: A visual representation of hidden/shown entities. (may be used for more editing ephemerals later)

remarks.remark: If the value of edithideentmask is not 0 (meaning all entities shown) then even if showeditingsettings is 0 the display will show up on the first toggle into editmode.
The values 1, 2 and 3 will make the display show up for every time you start editing. With 3 it will stay for ever.
For 2 the text will disappear after a time but the boxes will stay for ever. For 1 everything is hidden after the duration of editingsettingsvisibletime.

variable.name: shadowyaw
variable.description: Shadow yaw specifies the angle at which shadow stencils are drawn on a map.

value.valueNotes: The angle in degrees to rotate the stencil shadows

remarks.remark: When specifying shadowyaw, remember that the default angle is 45 degrees. The example below would make the shadows appear at 90 degrees (45 degrees more to the left).

variable.name: tagcliplinewidth
variable.description: The width of the tagclip lines.

variable.name: worldiodebug
variable.description: Whether or not to output debugging information while loading/saving maps.

variable.name: _nextentityispasted
variable.description: Set to 1 just before calling a newent command where all attributes are meant to be kept.

remarks.remark: It is used in the pasteent scripting.

When creating a new entity of type mapmodel, playerstart or CTF flag the orientation is taken from your current viewing angle. To disable this behaviour for one call only you set the value to of this to 1 and then issue your newentity call with all attributes given.

section.name: Menus
section.description: This section describes identifiers related to the menu gui.

command.name: menuinit
command.description: Specifies commands to be executed when a menu opens.

remarks.remark: This command should be placed after newmenu.

argument.description: the code to execute on init

command.name: newmenu
command.description: Creates a new menu.

remarks.remark: All menu commands placed after newmenu (i.e. menuitem, menuitemcheckbox, etc.) are added into the menu until another "newmenu" command is specified.

command.name: menuitem
command.description: Creates a new menuitem.

remarks.remark: Upon activating the menuitem, the associated command will be executed (See config/menus.cfg for examples). If the command argument is omitted, then it will be set to the same value as the description. If -1 is specified instead of the command to execute, then no command is executed when activating the item. If the rollover option is used, the menuitem will execute that command when selecting (but not activating) the menuitem.
'\n' in menuitem synchronizes further text with slider width (tab-like function).
(Note: to activate the menu item, select it, and either: Click, press SPACE or press ENTER/Return).

argument.description: the text content in menu line
the command to execute on selection of the menuitem
the command to execute upon rolling over the menuitem
the description of menu item, which is displayed on the menu footer

command.name: menuinitselection
command.description: Defines the initial selection for a menu.

command.name: menuitemaltfont
command.description: Displays a menu line with a text which may contain chars from an alternate font.

remarks.remark: Chars from the alternate font have to be marked with "\a". Alternate font chars have no width and are just rendered above the following text. Use spaces to counter that.

argument.description: the name of the alternate font
argument.valueNotes: default, mono, serif, huddigits, serverquality, bargraphs, radaricons

command.name: menuselection
command.description: Selects a line in a menu.

command.name: menuselectionpersistent
command.description: Enables persistent selections for the currently displayed menu.

remarks.remark: When enabled, it restores a previously saved selection.

Probably most efficient inside "menuinit". The position is restored during execution of this command, so the menu entry has to already exist and the alias with the last position has to be read from saved.cfg. In automatically created menus it may be necessary to execute the command with a short delay.

command.name: menuselectionbgcolor
command.description: Defines the background color for the menu selection bar.

command.name: menuselectiondescbgcolor
command.description: Defines the background color for the description of selected active menu items (checkbox, slider, text input).

command.name: menuitemcheckbox
command.description: Creates a checkbox menu item.

remarks.remark: Optional fourth parameter "position" in the range from 0 o 100, default 0, which moves the position of the checkbox over the width of a text input or slider, with 100 being left and 0 being right.

variable.name: hidebigmenuimages
variable.description: Hide big images in menus.

command.name: menuitemkeyinput
command.description: Menuitem which displays "text" and all keys, that bind "bindcmd" - in game mode.

command.name: menuitemeditkeyinput
command.description: Menuitem which displays "text" and all keys, that bind "bindcmd" - in edit mode.

command.name: menuitemspectkeyinput
command.description: Menuitem which displays "text" and all keys, that bind "bindcmd" - in spectate mode.

command.name: menuitemmapload
command.description: Menuitem that loads a map, displays the title and the preview or a default image.

command.name: screenshotpreview
command.description: Creates a screenshot cropped to 4:3 with a given number of lines and jpeg quality 80.

remarks.remark: Pressing CTRL+F12 during spectating creates a clean screenshot and saves it as map preview picture.

key.name: Ctrl+F12
key.description: creates map preview pictures during spectating

argument.valueNotes: max value (or optionally -1 and set by display string length)
list of value descriptions or value step size
executed on value changes (new value in arg1)
max value (or optionally -1 and set by display string length)
list of value descriptions or value step size
executed on value changes (new value in arg1)

command.name: menuitemtextinput
command.description: Creates a new menuitem with text input field.

remarks.remark: If the last line of a menu is a text input item, pressing enter in that line will not only execute the assigned command, but also close the menu.

command.name: menuitemgreyedout
command.description: Menu items added after this command are greyed out (1) or not (0).

remarks.remark: Greyed out menu items are grey and can't be operated.

command.name: menuheader
command.description: Adds header and/or footer to the menu.

variable.name: browsefiledesc
variable.description: Toggles getting descriptive text from CGZ or DMO files in menudirlist.

command.name: menudirlist
command.description: Creates a menu listing of files from a path and perform an action on them when clicked.

remarks.remark: Use this inside menu definitions, almost always as the only command of that menu.
Compare the usage inside config/menus.cfg

argument.description: the directory path from the assaultcube root
string - search it in map/demo filenames and descriptions and show only matched files (case insensitive)

example.explanation: will create a list of maps and load them when clicked

command.name: menudirlistsub
command.description: Adds subdirectory entries to a menu with a files list.

remarks.remark: It has to come after the menudirlist command.

argument.description: action, executed, when the menu entry is chosen
if it is 1, an entry '..' is added (parent directory)

command.name: menufont
command.description: Sets the font for a specific menu.

remarks.remark: If menu is "", the currently initialised menu is used.

example.explanation: sets the font on the scoreboard

command.name: showmenu
command.description: Displays the specified menu.

remarks.remark: The menu allows the user to pick an item with the cursor keys. Upon pressing return, the associated action will be executed. Pressing ESC will cancel the menu.

argument.description: the name of a previously defined menu

command.name: closemenu
command.description: Closes the specified menu if it is open.

remarks.remark: If it is open multiple times in the stack only the topmost instance will be closed!

argument.description: the name of a previously defined menu

command.name: delmenu
command.description: Deletes the entire contents (all menu items) of the given menu.

argument.description: the name of a previously defined menu

command.name: menumdl
command.description: Specifies a model to render while displaying the specified menu.

remarks.remark: If menu is "", the currently initialised menu is used.
It specifies, which model to render and how. If only menu is specified, no model is rendered.

command.name: chmenutexture
command.description: Displays a texture on the right side of a menu.

remarks.remark: By specifying a title string in the third argument to chmenutexture, a picture is rendered instead of a texture. The title string is displayed instead of the texture resolution. The variable "menupicturesize" holds a size modifier for pictures, similar to "menutexturesize".

variable.name: menutexturesize
variable.description: Changes the size of textures displayed in menus (mostly for testing purposes).

variable.name: menupicturesize
variable.description: Changes the size of pictures displayed in menus.

variable.name: wrapslider
variable.description: If wrapslider is set the menuitemslider will toggle to the min/max value if at end of the range.

command.name: menucanblink
command.description: Toggles the ability for menutext to have the blinking bit set.

remarks.remark: The global setting of 'allowblinkingtext' overrides this.

argument.valueNotes: Any integer is valid, positive or negative

command.name: curmenu
command.description: Returns the name of the currently open menu.

remarks.remark: If more than one menu is open, only the name of the topmost menu on the stack is returned.

command.name: closecurmenu
command.description: Closes the currently open menu.

remarks.remark: If more than one menu is open, only closes the topmost menu on the stack.

command.name: refreshcurmenu
command.description: Refreshes (closes and opens again) the current menu.

command.name: refreshcurmenudelayed
command.description: Refreshes (closes and opens again, after very short delay) the current menu.

command.name: menurenderoffset
command.description: Moves a menu away from the middle of the screen.

remarks.remark: Values of "0" represent half the screen width and height.

command.name: menusynctabstops
command.description: Synchronizes tabs in menus.

remarks.remark: If enabled (1), tab positions in a menu are synchronised. It affects menu title, header and items, but not footer or descriptions.

command.name: menutitle
command.description: Make a different title show up than the menu's internal name.

remarks.remark: Intended to pretty up the menus with more readable titles than the sometimes short but technical values that make the scripting easier!

section.name: Heads-Up Display
section.description: This section describes the identifiers to configure the head-up display (HUD).

variable.name: gametimedisplay
variable.description: Show the game-time clock on the HUD.

remarks.remark: The clock can count backward (from time limit to 0s) or forward (from 0s to time limit).

variable.name: wallclockformat
variable.description: Show the wall clock with time (usually local, not game-time) on the HUD.

remarks.remark: "wallclockformat" alias should contain string in strftime format to show the clock with proper time. If the alias is empty, the wall clock is hidden.

variable.name: showmap
variable.description: Determines if the mini-map should be shown on screen.

variable.name: showmapbackdrop
variable.description: Determines whether to have a see-through map overview (0), or render it on a black backdrop (1) or a combination of both (2).

variable.name: showmapbackdroptransparency
variable.description: Transparency of the black map backdrop (in percent) rendered if showmapbackdrop is set to 2.

command.name: clearminimap
command.description: Recreates the minimap for the current map.

variable.name: minimapres
variable.description: Sets the resolution for the minimap.

variable.name: hidecompass
variable.description: Turns on/off the radar compass.

variable.name: overviewflags
variable.description: Rendering options for the flags in the overview spectator mode.

remarks.remark: Viewed from directly above the pole is barely visible and the undulating canvas never comes out of perfect alignment so is invisible. To compensate for the realistic rendering there are two variations on rendering flags when in the overview - either we rotate the models a bit so they become visible or we use the radar display of bases and flags instead.

variable.name: hidedamageindicator
variable.description: Turns on/off the damage indicator.

variable.name: oldfashionedgunstats
variable.description: Shows ammo statistics like in version 1.0.

command.name: toggleconsole
command.description: Toggles the console.

variable.name: confade
variable.description: Sets how many seconds before the console text rolls (disappears) up the screen.

value.description: time before the text rolls up

variable.name: consize
variable.description: Sets how many lines of text the console displays.

variable.name: altconsize
variable.description: Sets the percent of screen height for text lines on an alternate F11 history display.

variable.name: fullconsize
variable.description: Sets the percent of screen height for text lines on the F11 history display.

variable.name: hideconsole
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of console text.

variable.name: hidehudequipment
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of equipment icons.

variable.name: hidehudmsgs
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of messages at the bottom of the screen.

variable.name: hidespecthud
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of spectator status.

variable.name: hideteamscorehud
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of team score icons.

variable.name: flagscorehudtransparency
variable.description: Options for flag score hud transparency.

value.valueNotes: 0: no transparency, icon set 'flag gone'; 1: transparency, icon set 'flag gone'; 2: transparency, classic icon set

variable.name: hidektfindicator
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of ktf flag direction indicator.

variable.name: ktfindicatoralpha
variable.description: Sets the level of transparency of ktf flag direction indicator, 100 = totally solid.

variable.name: hideteam
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of local player team icons.

variable.name: hideradar
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of the on-screen radar.

variable.name: hidevote
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of vote icons.

variable.name: hudgun
variable.description: Turns on or off the display of the current selected gun.

variable.name: specthudgun
variable.description: Turns on/off the display of the hudgun while spectating a player in first-person view.

remarks.remark: Works in demo mode as well.

variable.name: showstats
variable.description: Turns on/off display of FPS/rendering statistics on the HUD.

value.description: 0: Show no stats, 1: Only show FPS stats, 2: Show all stats

variable.name: dbgpos
variable.description: Displays local player's current x,y,z position in map, showstats 1 must be enabled.

variable.name: crosshairteamsign
variable.description: Turns on/off display of team warning crosshair.

variable.name: damageindicatoralpha
variable.description: Sets the level of transparency of the damage indicator, 100 = totally solid.

variable.name: damageindicatordist
variable.description: Sets the separation of the arrows in the damage indicator.

variable.name: damageindicatorsize
variable.description: Sets the size of the damage indicator.

variable.name: damageindicatortime
variable.description: Sets how long the damage indicator stays on screen.

variable.name: damagescreen
variable.description: Show the blood-spat overlay when receiving damage?

variable.name: damagescreenalpha
variable.description: If overlay of blood-spat, at what blending (transparency) level?

variable.name: damagescreenfactor
variable.description: If overlay of blood-spat, use which factor?

variable.name: damagescreenfade
variable.description: If overlay of blood-spat, at what speed does it fade?

variable.name: crosshairsize
variable.description: Sets the size of your crosshair.

remarks.remark: The crosshair is turned off entirely if the size is set to 0.

variable.name: crosshairfx
variable.description: Turns on or off crosshair effects.

remarks.remark: When on, the crosshair will go orange when health is 50 or red when is 25. Size change of crosshair occurs when player holds assault rifle and has more than 3 shots in a row.

argument.description: turn on all effects (color and size change)
turn on color change/turn off size change
turn off color change/turn on size change

variable.name: radarentsize
variable.description: Sets the icon size of the players shown in the radar and the minimap.

variable.name: cncolumncolor
variable.description: Colour of CN column in scoreboard.

variable.name: radarheight
variable.description: Changes at what height you are floating in the radar-view.

variable.name: showtargetname
variable.description: Enables or disables showing the player name on the HUD when in your crosshair.

variable.name: showspeed
variable.description: Enables or disables showing the player's horizontal speed (vector).

variable.name: blankouthud
variable.description: Hides most of elements on the HUD for X frames.

remarks.remark: Used for "clean" screenshot. The parameter is "frames", so for example 1000 will take 20 seconds at 50 fps or second at 1000 fps.

command.name: showscores
command.description: Shows or hides the scores.

variable.name: showscoresondeath
variable.description: Determines if scores should be shown on death.

variable.name: sc_flags
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column flags on the scoreboard.

value.description: low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_frags
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column frags on the scoreboard.

value.description: low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_deaths
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column deaths or disables it on the scoreboard.

value.description: -1: disable, low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_ratio
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column ratio or disables it on the scoreboard.

value.description: -1: disable, low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_score
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column score or disables it on the scoreboard.

value.description: -1: disable, low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_lag
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column pj/ping or disables it on the scoreboard.

value.description: -1: disable, low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_clientnum
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column cn on the scoreboard.

value.description: low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: sc_name
variable.description: Sets the order priority for the column name on the scoreboard.

value.description: low priority: left, high priority: right

variable.name: accuracy
variable.description: Sets whether or not to display the accuracy information window.

remarks.remark: Accuracy is displayed for current weapon and only then, if scoreboard is turned on.

command.name: accuracyreset
command.description: Resets accuracy counters.

command.name: accuracyinfo
command.description: Shows in the console accuracy of all used weapons.

variable.name: conalpha
variable.description: Sets the transparency of the console.

variable.name: votealpha
variable.description: Sets the transparency of the vote display.

section.name: Visuals
section.description: This section describes identifiers to configure the visuals.

command.name: resetgl
command.description: Resets the OpenGL rendering settings.

command.name: screenres
command.description: Changes the screen resolution.

variable.name: desktopw
variable.description: Returns a width of the desktop resolution (or zero, if not available).

variable.name: desktoph
variable.description: Returns a height of the desktop resolution (or zero, if not available).

command.name: getdisplayresolutions
command.description: Returns a list of available screen resolutions.

command.name: glext
command.description: Checks for the searchstring in all loaded extensions.

example.code: if (glext shadow_funcs) [echo you have shadow functionality] [echo no shadows for you]

command.name: fpsrange
command.description: Sets the range of FPS (AC will adjust LOD to achieve it).

variable.name: maxfps
variable.description: Limits the FPS (frames per second) of AssaultCube's video output.

remarks.remark: Remark: limit to '200' is optimal.

variable.name: stencilshadow
variable.description: Sets the transparency/opacity level of stencil shadows.

variable.name: tsswap
variable.description: Swaps vertices of model triangles.

command.name: font
command.description: Loads a font texture to use as text within AssaultCube.

argument.description: the path to the font texture

command.name: fontchar
command.description: Specifies a region of an image to be used as a font character.

command.name: fontskip
command.description: Specifies, at what char the font definition proceeds.

remarks.remark: For example "fontskip 48" means the ascii code of the first char in defined font will be "48", which is '0'; "fontskip 65" would start at 'A'.

argument.description: the ascii code of the first char

command.name: setfont
command.description: Changes the current font.

command.name: curfont
command.description: Returns a name of the current font.

variable.name: fov
variable.description: Sets the field of view (fov).

variable.name: aboveheadiconsize
variable.description: Sets the size for the icon shown above a player using comunications voices.

variable.name: aboveheadiconfadetime
variable.description: Time in milliseconds before the abovehead icon dissapears.

variable.name: bloodttl
variable.description: Sets the amount of time in milliseconds that blood is displayed on the ground.

variable.name: blood
variable.description: Turns on and off the display of blood.

variable.name: gib
variable.description: Enables or disables the gib animation entirely.

variable.name: gibnum
variable.description: Sets the number of gibs to display when performing a "messy" kill (grenade, knife, sniper headshot).

remarks.remark: Larger values are more spectacular, but can slow down less powerful machines. Reducing gibttl may help in this case.

variable.name: gibttl
variable.description: Sets the time for gibs to live (in milliseconds), after which they will disappear.

variable.name: gibspeed
variable.description: Sets the velocity at which gibs will fly from a victim.

variable.name: teamdisplaymode
variable.description: Sets the team display mode.

remarks.remark: In mode 0 team display is disabled In mode 1 players will be rendered with a colored vest to make the teams distinguishable. In mode 2 almost the whole suit of the players will be colored. These display modes are only applied in team gameodes.

variable.name: aadynshadow
variable.description: Sets the size/resolution of the dynamic shadow data.

variable.name: dynshadowsize
variable.description: Sets the display size of the dynamic shadows.

variable.name: saveshadows
variable.description: Sets if dynamic shadows should be saved to disk.

variable.name: dynshadow
variable.description: Sets the alpha value (transparency) for dynamic shadows.

variable.name: dynlight
variable.description: Determines whether dynamic shadows and lights are rendered, provided just incase they slow your fps down too much.

variable.name: watersubdiv
variable.description: Determines the subdivision of the water surface in maps.

remarks.remark: Must be a power of 2: 4 is the default, 8 is recommended for people on slow machines, 2 is nice for fast machines, and 1 is quite OTT. See "waterlevel" (edit reference) on how to add water to your own levels.

variable.name: waterreflect
variable.description: Turns on/off the reflections in the water surface.

variable.name: waterrefract
variable.description: Turns on/off water refractions.

variable.name: waveheight
variable.description: Sets the wave height of water, between 0 (completely still, no waves at all) and 1 (very choppy).

variable.name: fullscreen
variable.description: Enables or disables fullscreen.

command.name: fullscreentoggle
command.description: Toggles fullscreen on or off.

variable.name: hwmaxaniso
variable.description: Shows the maximum level of anisotropic filtering supported by the graphics hardware.

variable.name: aniso
variable.description: Sets the level of anisotropic filtering.

variable.name: fsaa
variable.description: Sets the level of full-scene antialiasing (FSAA).

remarks.remark: -1 uses the default settings obtained from the system. 0 disables, 1..16 enables FSAA.

variable.name: scr_w
variable.description: Sets the screen width.

variable.name: scr_h
variable.description: Sets the screen height.

variable.name: screenw
variable.description: Returns the actual width of the screen/window.

variable.name: screenh
variable.description: Returns the actual height of the screen/window.

variable.name: fullscreendesktop
variable.description: Enables using always desktop resolution in fullscreen mode.

variable.name: depthbits
variable.description: Sets the bits for the depth buffer.

variable.name: vsync
variable.description: Enables or disables vsync.

remarks.remark: -1 uses the default settings obtained from the system. 0 disables, 1 enables vsync.

variable.name: gamma
variable.description: Sets the temporary (to next map start) hardware gamma value.

remarks.remark: May not work if your card/driver doesn't support it.

scriptalias.name: setgamma
scriptalias.description: Sets a persistent gamma value for a map.

variable.name: lighterror
variable.description: Allows to finetune the amount of "error" the mipmapper/stripifier allow themselves for changing lightlevels.

remarks.remark: If this variable is changed this during play, a "recalc" is needed to see the effect.

value.description: the error value, 1 being the best quality

variable.name: minlod
variable.description: Minimal level of detail.

variable.name: spectfov
variable.description: Specifies the Field Of View when in spectating/ghost mode.

variable.name: spectfovremote
variable.description: Chooses between local or remote player's FOV when spectating.

value.description: 0: uses 'spectfov' and the local 'scopefov', 1: uses 'fov' and 'scopefov' of the spectated player

variable.name: hwtexsize
variable.description: Shows the maximum texture size (in pixels) supported by the graphics hardware.

variable.name: maxtexsize
variable.description: The maximum texture size that will be used by the engine, larger textures will be scaled down.

remarks.remark: If this value is zero, hwtexsize will be used.

variable.name: maxtmus
variable.description: Gets the maximum number of supported textures when performing multitexturing.

variable.name: texreduce
variable.description: Reduces the size of all texture by the selected factor:
Note: -1 is a special mode which reduces all textures to flat coloured surfaces.

variable.name: hirestextures
variable.description: Controls whether textures with a scale higher than 1.0 will be scaled down while loading (0) or not (1).

variable.name: bulletholettl
variable.description: Specifies how long (in milliseconds) to display bullet holes.

variable.name: bullethole
variable.description: Turns on/off the display of bullet holes.

variable.name: particlesize
variable.description: Scales all particles.

variable.name: maxtrail
variable.description: Maximum number of smoke particles along shotline of sniper rifle.

variable.name: animationinterpolationtime
variable.description: Sets the time available for interpolation between model animations.

value.description: the amount of milliseconds for the interpolation

variable.name: gibsgore
variable.description: Adjusts gib/gibnum/gibspeed/gibttl variables collectively.

variable.name: popdeadplayers
variable.description: Makes dead players instantly pop out of existence, instead of falling over and sinking into the ground.

variable.name: maxroll
variable.description: Sets the maximum value the display will roll on strafing.

variable.name: maxrolleffect
variable.description: Sets the maximum value the display will roll when you get damages.

variable.name: maxrollremote
variable.description: Limits the maximum value the display will roll on strafing or if player gets damages, when spectating other players.

variable.name: righthanded
variable.description: Chooses whether the players hand carrying the weapon appears as right or left handed.

variable.name: allowblinkingtext
variable.description: For toggling on the ability for any text to have the blinking bit set.

command.name: skin
command.description: Determines the skin of the current player.

remarks.remark: See the player model folder for the according skin-id.

command.name: skin_cla
command.description: Chooses skin when playing for team CLA.

command.name: skin_rvsf
command.description: Chooses skin when playing for team RVSF.

variable.name: smoothdist
variable.description: Determines the valid distance when extrapolating a players position.

variable.name: smoothmove
variable.description: Determines the speed when extrapolating a players position.

command.name: getigraph
command.description: Returns an encoded string to display an inlined image outside the console.

remarks.remark: Images are stored in packages/misc/igraph/*.png and loaded during game start. Filenames consist of the image shorthand (mnemonic) and optional frame times, separated by "_". Media file names may only contain letters, digits and "_-.()".
All texts displayed in the game console are scanned for mnemonics prefixed with ":". All found matches are replaced by the image.

The images are displayed as squares with width and height the same as the regular font height. To create animations, put several square images side by side into the file. For example, a 128x32 image is interpreted as four frames. Frame duration is encoded in the filename, so, for example the file "nop_1000_200_100.png" shows the first frame for 1000 milliseconds, the second frame for 200 msec and the third (as the rest) for 100 msec.

Igraphs "1" to "9" are hardcoded and can be manually encoded in menu texts. Use the new escape code "\i" plus the number of the image: "\i\1".."\i\9". Other images can be used in menus as well, but the codes have to be fetched by "getigraph".
If the mnemonic was not found, then "getigraph" returns an empty string.

command.name: updateigraphs
command.description: Checks for new files in packages/misc/igraph/ folder.

remarks.remark: Only necessary, if new files are added during the game - for example, by mod package download.

variable.name: igraphsize
variable.description: Scales inlined images (in percent).

variable.name: igraphsizehardcoded
variable.description: Scales the hardcoded inlined images: "1".."9" (in percent).

variable.name: igraphanimate
variable.description: Enables animation of inlined images with multiple frames.

value.description: 0: display only first frame, 1: enable animation

variable.name: igraphdefaultframetime
variable.description: Default frame time for inlined images with multiple frames.

remarks.remark: Used for images with no frame duration specified in the filename.

variable.name: hideigraphs
