variable.description: Hides inlined images in the console.

variable.name: mapoverride_nowaterreflect
variable.description: Per-map override to disable water reflection on the client.

remarks.remark: Set by the mapper, for his map only. The overrides are stored in the map header.
If "1", water reflection is disabled. Useful, when odd water colours are used to emulate other liquids that are not supposed to be that reflective.

variable.name: mapoverride_limitwaveheight
variable.description: Per-map override to limit waveheight on the client.

remarks.remark: Set by the mapper, for his map only. The overrides are stored in the map header.
If "1", waveheight is capped at 0.1 max. Useful for small water areas (like puddles), where higher waves would look weird.

variable.name: mapoverride_nostencilshadows
variable.description: Per-map override to disable stencil shadows on the client.

remarks.remark: Set by the mapper, for his map only. The overrides are stored in the map header.

If "1", stencil shadows are disabled. On clients, where stencil shadows are otherwise enabled, blob shadows are used instead. If shadows are disabled anyway, they stay disabled. Useful for dim maps, where hard shadows make no sense.

variable.name: ignoreoverride_nowaterreflect
variable.description: Ignores per-map overrides to disable water reflection on the client.

remarks.remark: Ignores the overrides set by the mappers (for their maps only). If "1", mapoverride_nowaterreflect is ignored and regular client settings are used.

variable.name: ignoreoverride_limitwaveheight
variable.description: Ignores per-map overrides to limit waveheight on the client.

remarks.remark: Ignores the overrides set by the mappers (for their maps only). If "1", mapoverride_limitwaveheight is ignored, and "waveheight" is used unchanged.

variable.name: ignoreoverride_nostencilshadows
variable.description: Ignores per-map overrides to disable stencil shadows on the client.

remarks.remark: Ignores the overrides set by the mappers (for their maps only). If "1", mapoverride_nostencilshadows is ignored.

variable.name: lightscale
variable.description: Scaling factor for all light in the game.

value.valueNotes: values will be divided by this

remarks.remark: Any change will not take effect until a new world is loaded.

section.name: Sound
section.description: This section describes all identifiers related to music and sound effects.

variable.name: al_referencedistance
variable.description: The distance from the source emitting the sound to the listener.

variable.name: al_rollofffactor
variable.description: This value indicates the relative "strength" of a sound (how far away the sound can be heard).

command.name: sound
command.description: Plays the specified sound.

remarks.remark: See source/src/server.h file or use "enumsounds" command for default sounds, and use "registersound" to register your own. For example, 'sound 0' and 'sound (registersound "player/jump")' both play the standard jump sound.

argument.description: number of the sound to play

command.name: soundtest
command.description: Plays all hardcoded sounds in order.

command.name: mutesound
command.description: Mutes a specific game sound.

argument.description: ID of the sound to mute

command.name: soundmuted
command.description: Returns 1 if sound N is muted, else 0.

example.code: mutesound 5; if (soundmuted 5) [echo Sound 5 is muted!] [echo Sound 5 is not muted!]

command.name: unmuteallsounds
command.description: Unmutes all previously muted sounds.

variable.name: mapsoundrefresh
variable.description: Specifies the interval for checking mapsounds.

remarks.remark: If set to value 0, the map sounds will be checked in every frame without any interval limitation.

variable.name: audiodebug
variable.description: Enables verbose output for debugging purposes.

variable.name: gainscale
variable.description: Each subsequent played sound's gain-value is scaled by this percentage.

remarks.remark: This lowers the gain of the sounds before they are mixed, this might be useful in cases when the mixer has problems with too high gain values.

variable.name: musicvol
variable.description: Sets the music volume.

command.name: music
command.description: Plays music in the background.

argument.description: command to be executed, when music is done

command.name: musicpreload
command.description: Preloads the sound track.

remarks.remark: Can be helpful if you experience a delay, e.g. when picking up a flag.

command.name: registermusic
command.description: Registers a track as music.

remarks.remark: The first three tracks have special meaning: Track #1 is for "flag grab" the second and third are used as "last minute" tracks.

command.name: registersound
command.description: Registers a sound.

remarks.remark: This command returns the sound number, which is assigned from 0 onwards, and which can be used with "sound" command. If the sound was already registered, its existing index is returned. "registersound" does not actually load the sound, this is done on first play.

example.explanation: It registers packages/audio/player/jump.ogg sound with volume 80

argument.valueNotes: path below packages/audio/, without file extension

command.name: enumsounds
command.description: Lists sound index numbers and short descriptions for all sounds of one or more categories.

remarks.remark: All sounds with at least one of the flags will be listed. Flag names prefixed with "!" will exclude all matching sound from the list. If no such entities exist or the entity type could not be recognised, the list is empty.

example.explanation: It will list all voicecom sounds that are for teams only

argument.valueNotes: PAIN, OWNPAIN, WEAPON, PICKUP, MOVEMENT, BULLET, OTHER, VOICECOM, TEAM, PUBLIC, FFA, FLAGONLY

variable.name: audio
variable.description: Enables or disables the audio subsystem in AC.

variable.name: soundchannels
variable.description: Sets the desired amount of allocated sound channels.

remarks.remark: AC will try to allocate that number of channels but it is not guaranteed to succeed.

variable.name: footsteps
variable.description: Indicates if the footsteps sound should be played.

variable.name: localfootsteps
variable.description: Indicates if the footsteps sound for the local player should be played.

variable.name: hitsound
variable.description: Plays a sound upon every successful hit if enabled.

remarks.remark: If hitsound is set to 2, the sound will be played instantly rather than after server acknowledgment.

variable.name: soundvol
variable.description: Sets the sound volume for all sounds.

variable.name: heartbeat
variable.description: Defines the health level at or below which a heartbeat sound will be played.
variable.remark: A value of 0 (which is the default) disables this feature.

section.name: Ingame reference
section.description: This section describes all identifiers related to the ingame documentation reference.

command.name: docsection
command.description: Adds a new section to the ingame documentation.

command.name: docident
command.description: Adds a new identifier documentation to the last added section.

remarks.remark: An identifier represents a command or variable.
The name may contain spaces to create a "multipart" identifier documentation that can be used to describe a complex argument as a single pseudo identifier, look at the examples.

example.code: docident fov "Sets the field of view."
docident "newent light" "Adds a new light entity."

command.name: docargument
command.description: Adds a new argument documentation to the last added identifier.

remarks.remark: An argument represents either a command argument or a variable value.
The last argument of an identifier can be flagged as variable-length to indicate that it represents an unknown number of arguments.

command.name: docremark
command.description: Adds a new documentation remark to the last added identifier.

command.name: docexample
command.description: Adds an example to the last added identifier.

command.name: docref
command.description: Adds a new documentation reference to an identifier.

remarks.remark: The new reference is added to the last added identifier documentation.

variable.name: docrefvisible
variable.description: Render documentation references (docrefs) of the identifiers.

command.name: docundone
command.description: Outputs a list of yet undocumented identifiers (commands, variables, etc.).

remarks.remark: If the one argument is omitted, only the builtin identifiers will be listed. Therefore specify the argument other identifiers like aliases should be included too.
Note that the list also includes identifiers that contain the substrings "TODO" or "UNDONE" in their documentation.

command.name: docinvalid
command.description: Outputs a list of identifier documentations that do not match any existing identifier.

remarks.remark: Multipart identifiers are not included in this list, see 'docident'.

command.name: docfind
command.description: Searches for pattern in all ingame identifier documentations (reference) entries.

remarks.remark: If "silent" is zero or omitted, all found references are listed.
A table of all found entries is returned as result. For each entry, the index of the doc entry string that contains the pattern is listed.

command.name: getdoc
command.description: Returns a string of the specified identifier documentation (reference) entry.

remarks.remark: String index numbers match with the result of "docfind".

argument.description: the string index number of entry

command.name: docwritebaseref
command.description: Writes out a base XML documentation reference containing templates for the builtin identifiers.

remarks.remark: The generated reference is written to "docs/autogenerated_base_reference.xml" by default. The three arguments can be changed later on in the generated XML document.

command.name: dockey
command.description: Adds a new default key to an identifier.

variable.name: docskip
variable.description: Allows to scroll through the rendered identifier documentation.

variable.name: docvisible
variable.description: Render identifier documentation for the typed command in the console.

variable.name: docidentverbose
variable.description: Enables identifier details or statement analyser.

value.description: level of displaying the additional informations

command.name: docwritetodoref
command.description: Writes out an XML documentation reference file containing undocumented identifiers or identifiers marked with "TODO".

section.name: Serverbrowser
section.description: This section describes all identifiers related to the serverbrowser.

command.name: addserver
command.description: Adds a server to the list of server to query in the server list menu.

argument.description: the address of the server (hostname or IP)

command.name: clearservers
command.description: Clears the server list.

variable.name: showallservers
variable.description: Whether servers that have not yet responded to a ping should be shown in the server list.

command.name: updatefrommaster
command.description: Contacts the masterserver and adds any new servers to the server list.

remarks.remark: The servers are written to the config/servers.cfg file. This menu can be reached through the Multiplayer menu.

variable.name: mastertype
variable.description: Sets the method which client will use to contact the masterserver.

value.description: 0: direct TCP connection, 1: HTTP connection (via proxy)

variable.name: maxservpings
variable.description: Sets the number of servers to be pinged at once.

command.name: addfavcategory
command.description: Adds a new category in the serverbrowser favourites.

remarks.remark: Add new categories to your autoexec.cfg, check favourites.cfg for examples.

command.name: listfavcats
command.description: Lists all registered serverbrowser favourites categories.

variable.name: hidefavicons
variable.description: Hides favourites icons in serverbrowser.

variable.name: serverbrowserhidefavtag
variable.description: Hides favourites tag column in serverbrowser.

variable.name: serverbrowserhideip
variable.description: Hides server IP and port in serverbrowser.

variable.name: serversortdir
variable.description: Selects ascending of descending sort order in serverbrowser.

variable.name: serversortpreferofficial
variable.description: Sort official maps over custom maps in serverbrowser.

variable.name: showminremain
variable.description: Show 'minutes remaining' in serverbrowser.

variable.name: shownamesinbrowser
variable.description: Show player names in serverbrowser.

variable.name: showonlyfavourites
variable.description: Show only servers of one favourites category in serverbrowser.

variable.name: showonlygoodservers
variable.description: Show only servers with the correct protocol in serverbrowser.

variable.name: showweights
variable.description: Show 'weights' in serverbrowser.

remarks.remark: 'weights' are the sort criteria with the highest priority. Favourites categories can change the weights. Use 'showweights' to debug problems with serverbrowser sorting.

variable.name: showallplayersnumber
variable.description: Shows on serverbrowser number of all players on the all servers.

command.name: searchnickname
command.description: Search a nickname (or -part) on all servers.

section.name: Server commands
section.description: This section lists commands used by the client that communicate to the server. Most are used for server administration. Also see the "mode" section and the "map" command which also communicate to the server.

command.name: serverdesc
command.description: Sets user-define server description.

remarks.remark: If the server was run with -n1 and -n2 arguments (prefix and suffix of descriptive title) a serveradmin can set a user-defined server description with this command, if it wasn't this command results in "invalid vote". This title will only stay until the next map is loaded.

If, for example, the server was run with -n"Fred's Server" -n1"Fred's " -n2" Server", then you could call "/serverdesc [pWn4g3 TOSOK]" and it would show up as "Fred's pWn4g3 TOSOK Server" in the serverbrowser.

command.name: serverextension
command.description: Sends the extension name and argument string to the server, which can use it for custom action.

remarks.remark: See source/src/server.cpp ["case SV_EXTENSION:"].

command.name: autoteam
command.description: Sets automated team assignment.

command.name: ban
command.description: Temporary ban of the specified player from the server.

remarks.remark: Temporary ban duration is fixed at 20 minutes.

command.name: callvote
command.description: Calls a vote on the server.

remarks.remark: This command is wrapped by aliases for better usability and is used to action votes such as ban, kick, etc. See config/admin.cfg for actual uses.

command.name: forceteam
command.description: Calls a vote to force the specified player to switch to the specified team.

command.name: forceme
command.description: Calls a vote to forceteam yourself to the specified team.

argument.description: the team to force yourself to

remarks.remark: By default, if you are on team CLA or RVSF, this command will force you to the enemy team, no arguments necessary.

command.name: shuffleteams
command.description: Shuffles the teams.

remarks.remark: The server will attempt to restore balance, but the result may be less that optimal, and there are certainly better ways to keep teams balanced.

command.name: giveadmin
command.description: Gives admin state to the specified player.

remarks.remark: Requires admin state. The admin will lose his admin state after successfully issuing this command.

command.name: kick
command.description: Kicks the specified player from the server.

command.name: mastermode
command.description: Sets the mastermode for the server.

remarks.remark: If the mastermode is set to 'private', no more clients can join the server. Default is 'open' which allows anyone to join the server.

command.name: removebans
command.description: Removes all temporary bans from the server.

remarks.remark: Temporary bans are normally automatically removed after 20 minutes.

command.name: cleardemo
command.description: Clears specific demo currently in memory on the server.

command.name: cleardemos
command.description: Clears all demos currently in memory on the server.

command.name: sendmap
command.description: Sends a map to the server.

remarks.remark: During coop edit, the current map gets saved to file and sent to the server. Other players can use 'getmap' to download it.
When not in edit mode, the map will not be saved. The new map will be used, when the next game on that map starts on the server.

command.name: deleteservermap
command.description: Deletes a map from the current server.

command.name: setadmin
command.description: Claims or drops admin status.

remarks.remark: Failed logins result in an auto kick. The admin is granted the right to kick, ban, remove bans, set autoteam, set shuffleteam, change server description (if enabled), change map, change mastermode, force team, change mode, record demos, stop demos and clear demo(s) - All without needing votes from other users. If the admin votes on any (other players) call, his vote is final. In the scoreboard, the admin will be shown as a red colour.

command.name: getvita
command.description: Get vita for a client.

remarks.remark: TODO: elaborate

variable.name: serverdebug
variable.description: Whether or not to output debugging information.

remarks.remark: Only applies if you're running a client, the standalone server has DEBUGCOND(true) already set.

section.name: Authentication
section.description: This section describes identifiers related to player authentication.

command.name: authsetup
command.description: Manages player authentication.

remarks.remark: "authsetup" contains all the funtionality needed to generate, load and save private and public keys, and to lock and unlock the private key with a password.

Private and public keys are used to authenticate the player to servers, and are loaded from private/authprivate.cfg. Private keys can be stored in an "encrypted with password" version - in which case the player has to enter the password after game start. To prevent brute-force cracking of the password, the key-derivation function uses a constant time to encode (usually several seconds). Because of that, the decoding at game start can be done in the background.

The private key is actually itself a public key generated from the prepriv key. The prepriv key should be kept away from the computer, either as hardcopy or on a thumbdrive. The prepriv key is not required to play the game. It can be used to prove ownership of the private key, in case the private key gets stolen. It can also be used to regenerate private and public keys, in case they are lost. The prepriv key can also be encrypted by its own password.
Options:
"authsetup" - checks private and public key and returns "1", if they match.
"authsetup pre preprivhex [psalthex pwdcfg]" - loads prepriv key into memory. Optionally supports encrypted keys.
"authsetup priv privhex [salthex pwdcfg]" - loads private key into memory. Optionally supports encrypted keys.
"authsetup pub pubhex" - loads public key into memory.
"authsetup ppass preprivpass" - decrypts prepriv key with password.
"authsetup pass privpass" - decrypts private key with password.
"authsetup passd privpass [commandwhendone]" - decrypts private key with password in background. Optionally executes cubescript command when done.
"authsetup needpass" - returns "1", if the private key needs decryption.
"authsetup genpre [prelen]" - generates new prepriv key.
"authsetup genpriv" - generates private key from prepriv key.
"authsetup genpub" - generates public key from private key.
"authsetup savepre [preprivfilename]" - saves the prepriv key. The default filename is private/authpreprivate.cfg
"authsetup savepre [privatefilename]" - saves the private key. The default filename is private/authprivate.cfg

"authsetup newppass preprivpass [preprivfilename]" - encrypts prepriv key with new password and saves the result to file. The default filename is private/authpreprivate.cfg and an existing file gets overwritten - but the former file content is kept and also written, each line commented out.

"authsetup newpass privpass [privatefilename]" - encrypts private key with new password and saves the encrypted private key and the public key to file. The default filename is private/authprivate.cfg and an existing file gets overwritten - but the former file content is kept and also written, each line commented out.
"authsetup unarmed" - sets private and public keys to a fixed value. For testing only. Can be used to "log out". Only available in development versions of the game

"authmemusage", "authrounds", "authmaxtime" are only used, when new passwords are created (authsetup new[p]pass). "authmemusage" is the number of megabytes of RAM that are used for the password hash calculation. If "authrounds" is zero (as is default), then the hash algorithm calculates as many rounds as possible in the number of milliseconds specified in "authmaxtime". If "authrounds" is a positive number, then that is the number of rounds to be done, regardless the required time. Note that, since the password hash algorithm is not endianness-aware, it is not possible to move an encrypted password to a machine with different endianness. Moving between 32- and 64-bit machines should be no problem.

argument.valueNotes: [empty], pre preprivhex [psalthex pwdcfg], priv privhex [salthex pwdcfg], pub pubhex, ppass preprivpass, pass privpass, passd privpass [commandwhendone], needpass, genpre [prelen], genpriv, genpub, newppass preprivpass [preprivfilename], newpass privpass [privatefilename], unarmed

variable.name: authmemusage
variable.description: Sets a number of megabytes of RAM that are used for the password hash calculation (when new passwords are created).

variable.name: authrounds
variable.description: Sets a number of rounds, if greater than 0, then new password hashes are created with this fixed number of rounds.

variable.name: authmaxtime
variable.description: Sets an amount of time (in ms), new password hashes are created with this fixed amount of time.

command.name: authkey
command.description: Manages a list of keys other than the game key (which is managed by authsetup).

remarks.remark: For example, this can be server owner keys or clan boss keys. Options:
"authkey clear" - empties the list and comments out all lines in config/authkeys.cfg.
"authkey list" - lists all authkeys that are currently in memory.
"authkey delete keyname" - deletes the key "keyname" from memory.

"authkey new keyname" - generates a new key with the name "keyname". If a key of that name already exists, it is deleted. The key is added to the list in memory and also written to the file config/authkeys.cfg.

"authkey add keyname privkey" - adds a key with the name "keyname" to the list in memory. The privkey is a 32-byte hexadecimal string, preferrably generated by authkey new. The matching public key is generated automatically from the private key.
"authkey selfcert keyname [comment]" - generates a self-signed certificate for the key "keyname". Being able to create such a cert is proof, that you own the private key of a certain public key.

argument.valueNotes: clear, list, delete keyname, new keyname, add keyname privkey, selfcert keyname [comment]

command.name: mypubkey
command.description: Returns a public key of game account.

remarks.remark: It returns empty string, if no account exists or it is unusable (due to missing password, for example).

variable.name: cryptodebug
variable.description: Enables some debug messages in crypto.cpp file.

command.name: listcerts
command.description: List all certificates.

remarks.remark: TODO: elaborate

command.name: newcert
command.description: Create and sign certificates from Cubescript.

argument.valueNotes: X:line => pubkey or name; X:sign => actual privkey
X:line => actual pubkey, actual privkey or actual name, X:sign => a descriptive comment
newcert line name KEY => a descriptive comment

remarks.remark: TODO: elaborate

command.name: mode
command.description: Sets the gameplay mode to N for the next map loaded.

argument.description: Bot Team One Shot, One Kill

remarks.remark: You will need to define mode before loading the map or it will stay as the last mode played.
There are many aliases for you to use instead of remembering the numeric mapping.

example.code: mode 7; map ac_complex; echo "Bot Team Deathmatch on ac_complex"
mode 8; map ac_mines 4; echo "Bot Deathmatch on ac_mines for 4 minutes"

command.name: getmode
command.description: Returns the name of current game mode.

variable.name: gamemode
variable.description: Returns the number of current game mode.

command.name: curmodeattr
command.description: Checks the current game mode for certain attributes.

remarks.remark: Possible attributes are: team, arena, flag and bot.

variable.name: modeacronyms
variable.description: Toggles use of acronyms instead of full modenames in the serverbrowser, scoreboard, voting info.

command.name: modenum
command.description: Returns the mode number for a specified mode acronym.

remarks.remark: Returns -1 if not found.

variable.name: showmodedescriptions
variable.description: Enables or disables the showing of game mode descriptions on the console after map starts.

command.name: coop
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Co-operative Editing".

remarks.remark: See the "Co-operative map editing" section on the "Tips, tricks and advice" chapter of the map editing guide for more information.

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to edit

command.name: ctf
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Capture the Flag".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: dm
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Deathmatch".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: htf
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Hunt the Flag".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: ktf
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Keep the Flag".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: lms
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Survivor". Some players prefer the name "Last Man Standing" for this mode.

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: lss
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Last Swiss Standing".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: osok
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "One Shot, One Kill".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: pf
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Pistol Frenzy".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 10 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: tdm
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Team Deathmatch".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: tktf
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Team Keep the Flag".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: tosok
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Team One Shot, One Kill".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: tsurv
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Team Survivor".

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

command.name: vip
command.description: Starts a map with the mode "Hunt the Flag". Some players prefer the name "VIP" for this mode.

argument.description: The name of the map you wish to play
The time limit, in minutes (default 15 minutes if T is 0 or not specified)

section.name: Editing configs
section.description: All the below commands are used specifically in map configuration files. Some of these commands can also be used without the need of a map configuration file.

argument.valueNotes: SPARK (0), SMOKE (1), ECLOSEST (2), BLOOD (3), DEMOTRACK (4), FIREBALL (5), SHOTLINE (6), BULLETHOLE (7), BLOODSTAIN (8), SCORCH (9), HUDMUZZLEFLASH (10), MUZZLEFLASH (11), ELIGHT (12), ESPAWN (13), EAMMO (14), EPICKUP (15), EMODEL (16), ECARROT (17), ELADDER (18), EFLAG (19)

SPARK (0), SMOKE (1), ECLOSEST (2), BLOOD (3), DEMOTRACK (4), FIREBALL (5), SHOTLINE (6), BULLETHOLE (7), BLOODSTAIN (8), SCORCH (9), HUDMUZZLEFLASH (10), MUZZLEFLASH (11), ELIGHT (12), ESPAWN (13), EAMMO (14), EPICKUP (15), EMODEL (16), ECARROT (17), ELADDER (18), EFLAG (19)

command.name: mdltrans
command.description: Translates (= moves) the model.

command.name: mdlattribute
command.description: Adds a value for a specified attribute to the model.

remarks.remark: If used, specifies that the current model depends on parts of another custom model (which therefore also has to be downloaded) can only be used once per model config.
Example: 'mdlattribute' requires 'makke/signs/exit' could be used in 'signs/loading-dock/md2.cfg' to reuse 'makke/signs/exit/tris.md2' .

argument.valueNotes: keywords, desc, defaults, usage, author, license, distribution, version, requires

variable.name: fog
variable.description: Sets the fog distance.

remarks.remark: You can do this for tweaking the visual effect of the fog, or if you are on a slow machine, setting the fog to a low value can also be a very effective way to increase fps (if you are geometry limited). Try out different values on big maps / maps which give you low fps. It is also good for aesthetic features of maps especially when combined with "fogcolour".

variable.name: fogcolour
variable.description: Sets the fog and clearing colour.

command.name: loadnotexture
command.description: Binds a texture to be used if a slot couldn't be loaded with a given textures path.

remarks.remark: Binds the texture indicated in the filename to the texture slot of any textures that aren't found. The path is given exactly as with the texture-command, if it is omitted (or can't be loaded) the default is used. The default is located in packages/misc/notexture.jpg (not in packages/textures - where custom ones must reside!)

example.code: loadnotexture "makke/black.jpg" // Any missing texture will show up black

argument.description: file name of the texture to bind

command.name: getnotexture
command.description: Returns the current "notexture" path (set by loadnotexture).

variable.name: loadsky
variable.description: Loads a skymap for a map.

remarks.remark: The available skymaps reside in packages/textures/skymaps/..
The skymap name in the argument is required to start with "textures/skymaps/", but that part of the path can be omitted, and it should be used only up to the underscore "_" in the filename.
You can get the current skymap name with the $loadsky variable.

command.name: mapmodel
command.description: Registers a mapmodel that can be placed in maps.

remarks.remark: A mapmodel registered with this command can be placed in a map using the 'newent mapmodel' command. The bounding box is an invisible force surrounding the model, allowing players to collide against it, instead of walking through the mapmodel. For more information about this command, read mapediting5.xml.
Example: mapmodel 4 2 4 0 "modelname"
This mapmodel has a bounding box of 8x8x2 in size (X/Y/Z) and by default hovers 4 units above ground.
It also returns the number of the created slot, example: echo (mapmodel ...)

argument.description: The square radius of the bounding box.
The height of the bounding box.
The initial height offset from the ground.
This integer is redundant. Leave it at zero so you don't break the command.
The name of the map model
If '1', the model is preloaded, even if no entities use it

command.name: mapmodelreset
command.description: Resets the mapmodel slots/indices to 0 for the subsequent "mapmodel" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent mapmodel command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: mapsound
command.description: Defines a mapsound.

remarks.remark: Registers the sound as a map-specific sound. These map-specific sounds may currently only be used with "sound" entities within a map. The first map sound registered in a map has slot/index number 0 and increases afterwards.
It also returns the number of the created slot, example: echo (mapsound ...)

command.name: mapsoundreset
command.description: Resets the mapsound slots/indices to 0 for the subsequent "mapsound" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent mapsound command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: texture
command.description: Binds a texture to the current texture slot.

remarks.remark: Binds the texture indicated in the filename to the current texture slot and increments the slot number.
The texture is rendered at the given scale. At scale 1.0 (or if scale is 0), 32x32 texels cover one cube. At scale 2.0, which is the current maximum, it's 64x64.
It also returns the number of the created slot, example: echo (texture ...)

argument.description: Scale of the texture to load (should be a power of two).
File name of the texture to bind

command.name: texturereset
command.description: Sets the texture slots/indicies to 0 for the subsequent "texture" commands.

remarks.remark: Each subsequent texture command increases it again. See config/default_map_settings.cfg for an example.

command.name: watercolour
command.description: Determines the water colour in a map.

remarks.remark: You must define at least 3 first values, otherwise this command may not work correctly (use "1" as a placeholder if needed).

command.name: hexbinchunk
command.description: Part of a map file

remarks.remark: Internal for XMAP not intended for manual use

command.name: restorexmap
command.description: Declaration of map parts.

remarks.remark: Internal for XMAP not intended for manual use

variable.name: persistentxmaps
variable.description: Whether or not to save all xmaps on exist and restore them at game start.

remarks.remark: XMAP allows for visual comparison between maps.
TODO: elaborate

section.name: Bot mode
section.description: This section describes bot mode related identifiers. See also "docs/cube_bot-readme.txt".

command.name: idlebots
command.description: Enables or disables the processing of the bots artificial intelligence.

example.explanation: Will make the bots stand still.
Will enable the bots to move and shoot.

command.name: kickallbots
command.description: Kicks all bots out of the current game.

command.name: kickbot
command.description: Kicks the bot with the given name out of the current game.

argument.valueNotes: name of the bot to kick.

example.explanation: Will make the bot named "Robbie" dissapear from the current game.

command.name: addbot
command.description: Adds a bot for a given team with a given skill calling him a given name.

remarks.remark: This command only works for single player modes.

example.explanation: Will add a bot named Robbie with a medium skill level to the RVSF team.

command.name: addnbot
command.description: Adds a given count of bots for the given team with the given skill and select random names for them.

remarks.remark: This command only works for single player modes.
The name of the bots will be selected randomly.

example.explanation: Will add 2 bots with a bad skill level to the CLA team.

command.name: botskill
command.description: Changes the skill level for the given bot.

example.explanation: Changes the previous bot skill level of the bot named Robbie to a 'best' skill level.

command.name: botskillall
command.description: Changes the skill level for all bots.

example.explanation: Changes the previous bot skill level for all bots to a 'worse' skill level.

command.name: botsshoot
command.description: Enables or disables the ability of the bots to fire their weapons.

variable.name: xhairwpsel
variable.description: Determines if bot waypoints should be selected/placed using the crosshair or by the nearest location to your player.

value.description: Note: This is turned on by default.

command.name: setwptriggernr
command.description: Assigns a number to the nearest waypoint.

remarks.remark: This is only used for trigger waypoints, so that the bots go to triggers in the right order. If you don't do this bots will search for every trigger, even when they are not reachable yet.

command.name: wpinfo
command.description: Makes waypoints visible and either turns on or off the waypoint information display.

command.name: setwpyaw
command.description: Takes the current player yaw for the current waypoint.

command.name: togglebotview
command.description: When used you will see what the bot sees.

remarks.remark: Type it again (with or without name) to return to the game (you will respawn).

command.name: addwp
command.description: Adds a bot waypoint at the current position.

command.name: autowp
command.description: Automatically places waypoints.

command.name: delwp
command.description: Deletes the selected waypoint.

section.name: Optional
section.description: This section describes optional identifiers from the files in config/opt/ folder and commands, which enable them.

scriptalias.name: load_autosave
scriptalias.description: Loads optional obsolete autosave settings.

remarks.remark: To see the obsolete autosave settings, look at config/opt/autosave.cfg file.

scriptalias.name: load_compatibility
scriptalias.description: Loads optional compatibility settings for old scripts.

remarks.remark: To see the compatibility settings, look at config/opt/compatibility.cfg file.

scriptalias.name: load_survival
scriptalias.description: Loads optional settings for bot survival mode.

remarks.remark: To see the settings for survival, look at config/opt/survival.cfg file.
The settings are loaded, when bot survival mode is started via menu.

scriptalias.name: load_parsestring
scriptalias.description: Loads optional settings for string parsing.

remarks.remark: To see the string parsing settings, look at config/opt/parsestring.cfg file.

scriptalias.name: load_faq
scriptalias.description: Loads optional FAQ settings.

remarks.remark: To see the FAQ settings, look at config/opt/faq.cfg file.
The settings are loaded, when FAQ is open in menu.

scriptalias.name: load_convmap
scriptalias.description: Loads batch map conversion tools.

remarks.remark: To see the map conversion tools, look at config/opt/convmap.cfg file.

scriptalias.name: load_mapeditscripts
scriptalias.description: Loads extra map editing scripts.

remarks.remark: To see the map editing scripts, look at config/opt/mapeditscripts.cfg file.

command.name: parsestring
command.description: Loops through every character in the given string and executes the given block of cubescript on each iteration.

example.explanation: Uses echo on every character in the string: "Hello world"
Uses echo on every character in the string: "Hello world" --- Also outputs the position of each character in the string.

example.code: backwardsstring = []; parsestring "This will look interesting backwards." iter [backwardsstring = (concatword $backwardsstring $iter); if (= $__iter 0) [echo $backwardsstring]] 1

example.explanation: Example usage of the breakparse command. Uses echo on characters a through e, then breaks out of the parse.

argument.valueNotes: name of alias to use as iterator
cubescript to execute on each iteration

remarks.remark: Important: A secondary iterator alias (prefixed with a double underscore "__") is automatically created before each iteration that contains the character position data.

command.name: breakparse
command.description: Breaks out of a parsestring loop.

remarks.remark: Important: this command should only be used within the 3rd argument (the cubescript to execute) of parsestring.

command.name: trimAllWhitespace
command.description: Removes all whitespace characters from the given string.

example.code: echo (trimAllWhitespace " H e ll o w o r l d ")

command.name: trimAllUnnecessaryWhitespace
command.description: Removes all unnecessary leading and trailing whitespace characters from the given string.

example.code: echo (trimAllUnnecessaryWhitespace " H e ll o w o r l d ")
example.explanation: Outputs: "H e ll o w o r l d"

command.name: survival
command.description: Prepares a round of bot survival mode on the specified map.

remarks.remark: All official maps are compatible with survival, if you want to play survival on a custom map, prior edits/additions to the script are necessary, such as adding a zone for that specific map.

command.name: changegamma
command.description: Smoothly changes your gamma to the specified value.

remarks.remark: Remark: that's optional command, disabled by default, to enable it execute "run opt/survival" or start bot surival mode from menu.

example.explanation: Every 30 milliseconds your gamma is changed by 1 until it reaches its goal of gamma 300.

command.name: changespeed
command.description: Smoothly changes your gamespeed to the specified value.

remarks.remark: Remark: that's optional command, disabled by default, to enable it execute "run opt/survival" or start bot surival mode from menu.

example.explanation: Every 30 milliseconds your gamespeed is changed by 1 until it reaches its goal of gamespeed 1000.

command.name: alive
command.description: Returns 1 if the local player is alive.

command.name: curmode
command.description: Returns the mode number for the current game.

command.name: currole
command.description: Returns 1 if the local player has admin privileges, 0 otherwise.

command.name: curteam
command.description: Returns an integer indicating what team a client is currently on.

argument.valueNotes: returns the specified client's team instead

remarks.remark: Returns 0 for CLA, 1 for RVSF.
Returns 2 for CLA-spectator, 3 for RVSF-spectator.
Returns 4 for spectator.
By default this command returns what team *you* (player1) are currently on.

command.name: findpn
command.description: Finds player name with this client number.

command.name: getclientmode
command.description: Returns the current game mode number.

variable.name: orderscorecolumns
variable.description: Show the client number column on the scoreboard first?

command.name: pstat_score
command.description: Returns the score statistics for the player with the given client number.

example.explanation: The output is a list of FLAGS, FRAGS, DEATHS, POINTS, TEAM, TEAMKILLS, and NAME.

command.name: showedithide
command.description: Shows the settings for hidden entities (sparklies).

command.name: setedithide
command.description: Hides the list of entity types you set.

argument.description: list of entity types to hide
argument.valueNotes: light, playerstart, pistol, ammobox, grenades, health, helmet, armour, akimbo, mapmodel, ladder, ctf-flag, sound, clip, plclip

remarks.remark: Call "setedithide [lights mapmodels]" to just hide all lights and mapmodels.
Only shown entity types are potential 'closest entity'.
"setedithide" without any arguments restores visibility of all entities.

command.name: seteditshow
command.description: Hides all but the single entity type you give.

argument.description: the entity type to show exclusively
argument.valueNotes: light, playerstart, pistol, ammobox, grenades, health, helmet, armour, akimbo, mapmodel, ladder, ctf-flag, sound, clip, plclip

remarks.remark: Just run "seteditshow mapmodel" and see just the mapmodel entities.
The other entity types are ignored as closestentity too.
"seteditshow" without any argument hides all entities.

command.description: Increments an alias by 1.

command.name: ++f
command.description: Increments an alias by floating-point 1.
Decrements an alias by 1.

command.name: --f
command.description: Decrements an alias by floating-point 1.
